explanation.pa: Discusses both pros and cons.

text.en: Who was the founder of Sukarchakia Misl?
text.pa: ਸ਼ੁਕਰਚੱਕੀਆ ਮਿਸਲ ਦਾ ਸੰਸਥਾਪਕ ਕੌਣ ਸੀ ? [cite: 1494, 1506][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: Charat Singh was the founder of the Sukerchakia Misl. [cite: 1501]
explanation.pa: ਚੜਤ ਸਿੰਘ ਸ਼ੁੱਕਰਚੱਕੀਆ ਮਿਸਲ ਦਾ ਮੋਢੀ ਸੀ।

text.en: 1.12.1991 is the first Sunday of month. Which is the 4th Tuesday of December 1991?
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ ਮਹੀਨੇ ਦਾ ਪਹਿਲਾ ਐਤਵਾਰ 1.12.1991 ਨੂੰ ਆਉਂਦਾ ਹੈ, ਤਾਂ ਦਸੰਬਰ 1991 ਵਿੱਚ ਚੌਥਾ ਮੰਗਲਵਾਰ ਕਿਸ ਤਾਰੀਕ ਨੂੰ ਆਵੇਗਾ?

explanation.en: 1st Dec = Sun. 3rd Dec = 1st Tuesday. 4th Tuesday = 3 + 21 = 24th Dec.
explanation.pa: 1 ਦਸੰਬਰ = ਐਤਵਾਰ। 3 ਦਸੰਬਰ = ਪਹਿਲਾ ਮੰਗਲਵਾਰ। ਚੌਥਾ ਮੰਗਲਵਾਰ = 3 + 21 = 24 ਦਸੰਬਰ।

text.en: In a certain language 'A' is coded as '1', 'B' is coded as '2' and so on. How is 'CORONA' coded?
text.pa: ਇੱਕ ਖਾਸ ਭਾਸ਼ਾ ਵਿੱਚ 'A' ਨੂੰ '1', 'B' ਨੂੰ '2' ਕੋਡ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ, 'CORONA' ਨੂੰ ਕਿਵੇਂ ਕੋਡ ਕੀਤਾ ਜਾਵੇਗਾ?

explanation.en: Direct number coding: C(3) O(15) R(18) O(15) N(14) A(1).

text.en: Three resistors are connected in parallel combination in the circuit as shown. What is equivalent resistance of the circuit?
text.pa: ਸਰਕਟ ਵਿੱਚ ਤਿੰਨ ਪ੍ਰਤਿਰੋਧਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਸਮਾਨਾਂਤਰ ਬੱਧ ਵਿੱਚ ਜੋੜਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ (ਜਿਵੇਂ ਕਿ ਦਿਖਾਇਆ ਹੈ)। ਸਰਕਟ ਦਾ ਤੁੱਲ ਪ੍ਰਤੀਰੋਧ ਕੀ ਹੋਵੇਗਾ?

explanation.en: In a parallel circuit, the equivalent resistance is always less than the smallest individual resistance. Assuming standard question pattern.
explanation.pa: ਸਮਾਨਾਂਤਰ ਸਰਕਟ ਵਿੱਚ, ਤੁੱਲ ਪ੍ਰਤੀਰੋਧ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਸਭ ਤੋਂ ਛੋਟੇ ਵਿਅਕਤੀਗਤ ਪ੍ਰਤੀਰੋਧ ਤੋਂ ਘੱਟ ਹੁੰਦਾ ਹੈ।

text.en: Methane gas released from waste treatment plants can be used as a source of fuel. Which chemical equation represents combustion of methane to produce heat energy?
text.pa: ਵਿਅਰਥ ਉਪਚਾਰ ਪਲਾਂਟ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ ਪੈਦਾ ਹੋਈ ਮੀਥੇਨ ਬਾਲਣ ਦੇ ਰੂਪ ਵਿੱਚ ਵਰਤੀ ਜਾਂਦੀ ਹੈ। ਹੇਠ ਲਿਖੀਆਂ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ ਕਿਹੜੀ ਰਸਾਇਣਿਕ ਸਮੀਕਰਨ ਮੀਥੇਨ ਦੀ ਜਲਣਸ਼ੀਲਤਾ ਨੂੰ ਦਰਸਾਉਂਦੀ ਹੈ?

explanation.en: Combustion of methane: CH₄ + 2O₂ → CO₂ + 2H₂O + Heat.CH₄ is methane chemical formula.
explanation.pa: ਮੀਥੇਨ ਦਾ ਬਲਣਾ: CH₄ + 2O₂ → CO₂ + 2H₂O + ਤਾਪ।CH₄ ਮੀਥੇਨ ਦਾ ਰਸਾਇਣਿਕ ਢਾਂਚਾ ਹੈ।

text.en: If E is any event, then:
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ E ਕੋਈ ਘਟਨਾ ਹੈ ਤਾਂ :

explanation.en: The sum of probabilities of an event happening and not happening is always 1.
explanation.pa: ਕਿਸੇ ਘਟਨਾ ਦੇ ਵਾਪਰਨ ਅਤੇ ਨਾ ਵਾਪਰਨ ਦੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ ਦਾ ਜੋੜ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ 1 ਹੁੰਦਾ ਹੈ।

text.en: If the radius of a wire is decreased to one-third and its volume remains the same, then the new length of the wire increases by:
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ ਇੱਕ ਤਾਰ ਦਾ ਅਰਧਵਿਆਸ ਇੱਕ ਤਿਹਾਈ ਤੱਕ ਘਟਾਇਆ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਉਸਦਾ ਆਇਤਨ ਬਰਾਬਰ ਰਿਹੰਦਾ ਹੈ ਤਾਂ ਤਾਰ ਦੀ ਨਵੀਂ ਲੰਬਾਈ ਵਧਦੀ ਹੈ :

explanation.en: Volume V = πr²h. New radius r' = r/3. V' = π(r/3)²h' = π(r²/9)h'. Since V=V', h = h'/9 => h' = 9h. Length becomes 9 times.
explanation.pa: ਆਇਤਨ V = πr²h. ਨਵਾਂ ਅਰਧਵਿਆਸ r' = r/3. V' = π(r/3)²h' = π(r²/9)h'. ਕਿਉਂਕਿ V=V', h = h'/9 => h' = 9h. ਲੰਬਾਈ 9 ਗੁਣਾ ਹੋ ਜਾਵੇਗੀ।

text.en: If the area of the sector is one-fourth of the area of whole circle, then the angle subtended at the centre is:
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ ਇੱਕ ਅਰਧਵਿਆਸੀ ਖੰਡ ਦਾ ਖੇਤਰਫਲ ਪੂਰੇ ਚੱਕਰ ਦੇ ਖੇਤਰਫਲ ਦਾ ਇੱਕ ਚੁਥਾਈ ਹੈ ਤਾਂ ਚੱਕਰ ਦੇ ਕੇਂਦਰ ਤੇ ਬਣਿਆ ਕੋਣ ਬਰਾਬਰ ਹੈ :

explanation.en: Area of sector = (θ/360) * πr². Given Area = (1/4) * πr². So, θ/360 = 1/4 => θ = 90°.
explanation.pa: ਖੰਡ ਦਾ ਖੇਤਰਫਲ = (θ/360) * πr². ਦਿੱਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਖੇਤਰਫਲ = (1/4) * πr². ਇਸਲਈ, θ/360 = 1/4 => θ = 90°.

text.en: If radius and height of a right circular cone are equal to r, then curved surface area is:
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ ਇੱਕ ਸ਼ੰਕੂ ਦਾ ਅਰਧਵਿਆਸ ਅਤੇ ਉਚਾਈ r ਦੇ ਬਰਾਬਰ ਹੈ, ਤਾਂ ਉਸਦੀ ਸਤ੍ਹਾ ਦਾ ਖੇਤਰਫਲ ਹੈ :

explanation.en: Slant height l = √(r² + h²) = √(r² + r²) = r√2. CSA = πrl = πr(r√2) = √2πr².
explanation.pa: ਤਿਰਛੀ ਉਚਾਈ l = √(r² + h²) = √(r² + r²) = r√2. CSA = πrl = πr(r√2) = √2πr².

text.en: निम्नलिखित में से 'बादल' शब्द का सही पर्यायवाची विकल्प चुनिए
text.pa: निम्नलिखित में से 'बादल' शब्द का सही पर्यायवाची विकल्प चुनिए

explanation.en: Jalad (Cloud).
explanation.pa: ਜਲਦ (ਬੱਦਲ)। ਜਲਜ (ਕਮਲ), ਜਲਧੀ (ਸਮੁੰਦਰ)।

text.en: If a solid is made by a right circular cylinder surmounted by a right circular cone with same dimensions, then ratio of volume of whole solid and the volume of cone is:
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ ਇੱਕ ਬੇਲਨ ਦੇ ਉੱਤੇ ਇੱਕ ਸ਼ੰਕੂ ਰਖ ਕੇ ਠੋਸ ਬਣਾਇਆ ਹੈ ਜਿਸ ਵਿੱਚ ਬੇਲਨ ਅਤੇ ਸ਼ੰਕੂ ਦੀਆਂ ਵਿਮਾਵਾਂ ਬਰਾਬਰ ਹਨ ਤਾਂ ਠੋਸ ਅਤੇ ਸ਼ੰਕੂ ਦੇ ਆਇਤਨ ਦਾ ਅਨੁਪਾਤ ਹੈ :

explanation.en: Volume Cylinder = πr²h. Volume Cone = (1/3)πr²h. Total Vol = (4/3)πr²h. Ratio Total:Cone = (4/3) : (1/3) = 4:1.
explanation.pa: ਬੇਲਨ ਦਾ ਆਇਤਨ = πr²h. ਸ਼ੰਕੂ ਦਾ ਆਇਤਨ = (1/3)πr²h. ਕੁੱਲ ਆਇਤਨ = (4/3)πr²h. ਅਨੁਪਾਤ ਕੁੱਲ:ਸ਼ੰਕੂ = (4/3) : (1/3) = 4:1.

text.en: Point of intersection of the lines y=5x and 5y=x is:
text.pa: ਰੇਖਾਵਾਂ y=5x ਅਤੇ 5y=x ਦਾ ਕਾਟ ਬਿੰਦੂ ਹੈ :

explanation.en: Substitute y=5x into 5y=x => 5(5x)=x => 25x=x => 24x=0 => x=0. Then y=0.

text.en: A cyclic square of side x units is drawn in a circle, then radius of the circle is:
text.pa: ਇੱਕ ਚੱਕਰੀ ਵਰਗ ਦੀਆਂ ਭੁਜਾਵਾਂ ਦੀ ਲੰਬਾਈ x ਇਕਾਈ ਹੈ ਜਿਹੜਾ ਇੱਕ ਚੱਕਰ ਵਿਚਕਾਰ ਬਣਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ, ਤਾਂ ਚੱਕਰ ਦਾ ਅਰਧਵਿਆਸ ਹੈ ।

explanation.en: Diagonal of square = diameter of circle. Diagonal = x√2. Radius = Diameter/2 = x√2 / 2 = x/√2.
explanation.pa: ਵਰਗ ਦਾ ਵਿਕਰਣ = ਚੱਕਰ ਦਾ ਵਿਆਸ। ਵਿਕਰਣ = x√2. ਅਰਧਵਿਆਸ = ਵਿਆਸ/2 = x√2 / 2 = x/√2.

text.en: If P(E) is the probability of happening of any event, then:
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ P(E) ਕਿਸੀ ਘਟਨਾ ਦੇ ਹੋਣ ਦੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ ਹੈ ਤਾਂ :

explanation.en: Probability of any event (including 'not E') always lies between 0 and 1 inclusive.
explanation.pa: ਕਿਸੇ ਵੀ ਘਟਨਾ ਦੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ (ਜਿਸ ਵਿੱਚ 'not E' ਸ਼ਾਮਲ ਹੈ) ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ 0 ਅਤੇ 1 ਦੇ ਵਿਚਕਾਰ ਹੁੰਦੀ ਹੈ।

text.en: If ab is the difference between the mean and median of the numbers 2, 3, 4, 7, 104 and a = 19/3 then b is:
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ ab ਸੰਖਿਆਵਾਂ 2, 3, 4, 7, 104 ਦੇ ਮਧਮਾਨ ਅਤੇ ਮਧਿਕਾ ਵਿਚਕਾਰ ਫ਼ਰਕ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ a = 19/3 ਹੈ ਤਾਂ b ਬਰਾਬਰ ਹੈ ।

text.en: If the length of the shadow is equal to the length of the tree, then angle of elevation of the sun is:
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ ਇੱਕ ਰੁੱਖ ਦੇ ਪਰਛਾਵੇਂ ਦੀ ਲੰਬਾਈ ਰੁੱਖ ਦੀ ਲੰਬਾਈ ਦੇ ਬਰਾਬਰ ਹੈ ਤਾਂ ਸੂਰਜ ਦਾ ਉਚਾਣ ਕੋਣ ਹੈ ।

explanation.en: tan(θ) = Height/Shadow = 1. Therefore θ = 45°.
explanation.pa: tan(θ) = ਉਚਾਈ/ਪਰਛਾਵਾਂ = 1. ਇਸਲਈ θ = 45°.

text.en: If the radius and height of a right circular cone and a right circular cylinder are equal respectively, then the ratio of their volume is:
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ ਇੱਕ ਸ਼ੰਕੂ ਅਤੇ ਇੱਕ ਬੇਲਨ ਦਾ ਅਰਧਵਿਆਸ ਅਤੇ ਉਚਾਈ ਬਰਾਬਰ ਹੈ ਤਾਂ ਉਹਨਾ ਦੇ ਆਇਤਨ ਦਾ ਅਨੁਪਾਤ ਹੈ :

explanation.en: Vol Cone : Vol Cylinder = (1/3)πr²h : πr²h = 1:3.
explanation.pa: ਸ਼ੰਕੂ ਦਾ ਆਇਤਨ : ਬੇਲਨ ਦਾ ਆਇਤਨ = (1/3)πr²h : πr²h = 1:3.

text.en: In an arithmetic progression, which of the following is true?
text.pa: ਇੱਕ ਅੰਕ ਗਣਿਤਕ ਲੜੀ ਵਿੱਚ ਹੇਠ ਲਿਖੇ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ ਕਿਹੜਾ ਸਹੀ ਹੈ ?

explanation.en: The nth term (aₙ) is the difference between the sum of n terms (Sₙ) and the sum of n-1 terms (Sₙ₋₁). So aₙ = Sₙ - Sₙ₋₁
explanation.pa: nਵਾਂ ਪਦ (aₙ) n ਪਦਾਂ ਦੇ ਜੋੜ (Sₙ) ਅਤੇ n-1 ਪਦਾਂ ਦੇ ਜੋੜ (Sₙ₋₁) ਵਿਚਕਾਰ ਫਰਕ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਲਈ aₙ = Sₙ - Sₙ₋₁

text.en: If the roots of cx² + bx + c = 0 are real, then:
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ cx² + bx + c = 0 ਦੇ ਮੂਲ ਵਾਸਤਵਿਕ ਹਨ ਤਾਂ :

explanation.en: For real roots, Discriminant D ≥ 0. D = b² - 4(c)(c) = b² - 4c². So b² - 4c² ≥ 0 => (b-2c)(b+2c) ≥ 0.
explanation.pa: ਵਾਸਤਵਿਕ ਮੂਲਾਂ ਲਈ, D ≥ 0. D = b² - 4c². ਇਸ ਲਈ b² - 4c² ≥ 0 => (b-2c)(b+2c) ≥ 0.

text.en: Which of the following is the smallest positive integer that can be expressed as the sum of cubes of two natural numbers in two different ways?
text.pa: ਹੇਠ ਲਿਖੇ ਵਿਚੋਂ ਕਿਹੜਾ ਸਭਤੋਂ ਛੋਟੀ ਧਨਾਤਮਕ ਸੰਪੂਰਨ ਸੰਖਿਆ ਹੈ ਜਿਸਨੂੰ ਦੋ ਵਖਰੇ ਤਰੀਕਿਆਂ ਨਾਲ ਦੋ ਪ੍ਰਾਕਰਤਿਕ ਸੰਖਿਆਂਵਾਂ ਦੇ ਘਣ ਦੇ ਜੋੜ ਦੇ ਤੌਰ ਤੇ ਦਰਸ਼ਾਇਆ ਜਾ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ?

explanation.en: 1729 is the Hardy-Ramanujan number. 1729 = 1³ + 12³ = 9³ + 10³.

text.en: If radius of a sphere and length of the edge of the cube are same, then the ratio of their volumes is:
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ ਇੱਕ ਗੋਲੇ ਦਾ ਅਰਧਵਿਆਸ ਅਤੇ ਇੱਕ ਘੰਣ ਦੇ ਕਿਨਾਰੇ ਦੀ ਲੰਬਾਈ ਬਰਾਬਰ ਹੈ ਤਾਂ ਉਹਨਾ ਦੇ ਆਇਤਨ ਦਾ ਅਨੁਪਾਤ ਹੈ :

explanation.pa: ਗੋਲੇ ਦਾ ਆਇਤਨ : ਘੰਣ ਦਾ ਆਇਤਨ = (4/3)πr³ : r³ = 88/21 : 1 = 88:21.

text.en: Which of the following represents sin θ?
text.pa: ਹੇਠ ਲਿਖੇ ਵਿਚੋਂ ਕਿਹੜਾ sin θ ਨੂੰ ਦਰਸ਼ਾਉਂਦਾ ਹੈ ?

explanation.en: tan θ * cos θ = (sin θ / cos θ) * cos θ = sin θ.
explanation.pa: tan θ * cos θ = (sin θ / cos θ) * cos θ = sin θ.

text.en: Democracy is a government of the people, for the people and by the people. Who said this?
text.pa: ਲੋਕਤੰਤਰ ਲੋਕਾਂ ਦੀ, ਲੋਕਾਂ ਲਈ ਅਤੇ ਲੋਕਾਂ ਦੁਆਰਾ ਸਰਕਾਰ ਹੈ। [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]ਇਹ ਕਿਸਨੇ ਕਿਹਾ ਸੀ ? [cite: 1409, 1410][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: This famous definition of democracy was given by Abraham Lincoln. [cite: 1409, 1426]
explanation.pa: ਲੋਕਤੰਤਰ ਦੀ ਇਹ ਮਸ਼ਹੂਰ ਪਰਿਭਾਸ਼ਾ ਅਬ੍ਰਾਹਮ ਲਿੰਕਨ ਦੁਆਰਾ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਗਈ ਸੀ।

text.en: Nawab Kapur Singh was the founder of this Misl. First of all, he occupied a village near Amritsar. He named it Singhpur. Therefore this Misl is also called Singhpuria Misl. What is the other name of this Misl?
text.pa: ਨਵਾਬ ਕਪੂਰ ਸਿੰਘ ਇਸ ਮਿਸਲ ਦਾ ਮੋਢੀ ਸੀ। ਸਭ ਤੋਂ ਪਹਿਲਾਂ, ਉਸਨੇ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤਸਰ ਦੇ ਨੇੜੇ ਇੱਕ ਪਿੰਡ ਉੱਤੇ ਕਬਜ਼ਾ ਕੀਤਾ। ਉਸਨੇ ਇਸਦਾ ਨਾਮ ਸਿੰਘਪੁਰ ਰੱਖਿਆ। ਇਸ ਲਈ ਇਸ ਮਿਸਲ ਨੂੰ ਸਿੰਘਪੁਰੀਆ ਮਿਸਲ ਵੀ ਕਿਹਾ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ। [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]ਇਸ ਮਿਸਲ ਦਾ ਦੂਸਰਾ ਨਾਮ ਕੀ ਸੀ? [cite: 1513, 1521][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: The Singhpuria Misl is also known as the Faizalpuria Misl. [cite: 1520]
explanation.pa: ਸਿੰਘਪੁਰੀਆ ਮਿਸਲ ਨੂੰ ਫੈਜ਼ਲਪੁਰੀਆ ਮਿਸਲ ਵੀ ਕਿਹਾ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ।

text.en: In which book describe the biography of Guru Gobind Singh Ji?
text.pa: ਗੁਰੂ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਸਿੰਘ ਜੀ ਦੀ ਜੀਵਨੀ ਕਿਸ ਪੁਸਤਕ ਵਿੱਚ ਦਰਜ ਹੈ? [cite: 1529, 1537][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: Bachitar Natak' is the autobiography of Guru Gobind Singh Ji. [cite: 1532]
explanation.pa: ਬਚਿੱਤਰ ਨਾਟਕ' ਗੁਰੂ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਸਿੰਘ ਜੀ ਦੀ ਸਵੈ-ਜੀਵਨੀ ਹੈ।

text.en: Which Guru Sahib composed the Bani (verses) Anand Sahib?
text.pa: ਆਨੰਦ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਦੀ ਬਾਣੀ ਕਿਸ ਗੁਰੂ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਨੇ ਰਚੀ? [cite: 1542, 1545][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: Anand Sahib was composed by the third Guru, Sri Guru Amardas Ji. [cite: 1544]
explanation.pa: ਅਨੰਦ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਦੀ ਰਚਨਾ ਤੀਜੇ ਗੁਰੂ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਗੁਰੂ ਅਮਰਦਾਸ ਜੀ ਨੇ ਕੀਤੀ ਸੀ।

text.en: Which of the following Bani (Religious Sermon) is not composed by Guru Nanak Dev Ji?
text.pa: ਹੇਠ ਲਿਖੀਆਂ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ ਕਿਹੜੀ ਬਾਣੀ ਗੁਰੂ ਨਾਨਕ ਦੇਵ ਜੀ ਦੁਆਰਾ ਨਹੀਂ ਰਚੀ ਗਈ ਹੈ? [cite: 1559, 1564][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: Jap Sahib was composed by Guru Gobind Singh Ji, whereas Japuji Sahib, Var Asa, and Var Majh are by Guru Nanak Dev Ji. [cite: 1562]
explanation.pa: ਜਾਪ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਦੀ ਰਚਨਾ ਗੁਰੂ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਸਿੰਘ ਜੀ ਨੇ ਕੀਤੀ ਸੀ, ਜਦੋਂ ਕਿ ਜਪੁਜੀ ਸਾਹਿਬ, ਵਾਰ ਆਸਾ ਅਤੇ ਵਾਰ ਮਾਝ ਗੁਰੂ ਨਾਨਕ ਦੇਵ ਜੀ ਦੀਆਂ ਹਨ।

text.en: What was the other name of Sayyidpur?
text.pa: ਸੈਯਦਪੁਰ ਦਾ ਦੂਜਾ ਨਾਮ ਕੀ ਸੀ? [cite: 1581][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: Sayyidpur was later renamed Eminabad (Aimnabad). [cite: 1575]
explanation.pa: ਸੈਯਦਪੁਰ ਦਾ ਨਾਂ ਬਾਅਦ ਵਿਚ ਐਮਨਾਬਾਦ ਰੱਖਿਆ ਗਿਆ।

text.en: In the period of which Mughal Emperor was the land between the two rivers called 'Doab'?
text.pa: ਕਿਸ ਮੁਗਲ ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹ ਦੇ ਕਾਲ ਵਿੱਚ ਦੋ ਦਰਿਆਵਾਂ ਦੇ ਵਿਚਕਾਰ ਦੀ ਧਰਤੀ ਨੂੰ 'ਦੁਆਬ' ਕਿਹਾ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਸੀ ? [cite: 1583, 1587][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: The term 'Doab' for the land between rivers was notably used and regions classified during Akbar's reign. [cite: 1586]
explanation.pa: ਅਕਬਰ ਦੇ ਰਾਜ ਦੌਰਾਨ ਦਰਿਆਵਾਂ ਦੇ ਵਿਚਕਾਰਲੀ ਜ਼ਮੀਨ ਲਈ 'ਦੋਆਬ' ਸ਼ਬਦ ਵਰਤਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।

text.en: Which of the following is not a major shipbuilding centre in India?
text.pa: ਹੇਠ ਲਿਖਿਆਂ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ ਕਿਹੜਾ ਭਾਰਤ ਵਿੱਚ ਇੱਕ ਪ੍ਰਮੁੱਖ ਜਹਾਜ਼ ਨਿਰਮਾਣ ਕੇਂਦਰ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੈ? [cite: 1751, 1757][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: Delhi is a landlocked city and does not have a shipbuilding centre. [cite: 1756]
explanation.pa: ਦਿੱਲੀ ਇੱਕ ਜ਼ਮੀਨੀ ਸ਼ਹਿਰ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਇੱਥੇ ਜਹਾਜ਼ ਬਣਾਉਣ ਦਾ ਕੇਂਦਰ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੈ।

text.en: Bombay Stock Exchange was established in 1875 A.D. at Dalal Street, Mumbai. It is one of the oldest stock exchanges in the world. Its performance is measured by .........
text.pa: ਬੰਬੇ ਸਟਾਕ ਐਕਸਚੇਂਜ 1875 ਈ. ਵਿੱਚ ਮੁੰਬਈ ਦੇ ਦਲਾਲ ਸਟਰੀਟ ਵਿਖੇ ਸਥਾਪਿਤ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ। ਇਹ ਦੁਨੀਆ ਦੇ ਸਭ ਤੋਂ ਪੁਰਾਣੇ ਸਟਾਕ ਐਕਸਚੇਂਜਾਂ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ ਇੱਕ ਹੈ। [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]ਇਸਦੀ ਕਾਰਗੁਜ਼ਾਰੀ ਨੂੰ ......... ਦੁਆਰਾ ਮਾਪਿਆ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ। [cite: 1592, 1594][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: The performance of the Bombay Stock Exchange is measured by the SENSEX. [cite: 1599]
explanation.pa: ਬੰਬੇ ਸਟਾਕ ਐਕਸਚੇਂਜ ਦੀ ਕਾਰਗੁਜ਼ਾਰੀ ਨੂੰ ਸੈਂਸੈਕਸ ਦੁਆਰਾ ਮਾਪਿਆ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ।

text.en: As the 'Agmark logo' is used for Agricultural Products, which logo is used for Gold jewellery?
text.pa: ਜਿਵੇਂ ਕਿ ਐਗਮਾਰਕ ਲੋਗੋ ਖੇਤੀਬਾੜੀ ਉਤਪਾਦਾਂ ਲਈ ਵਰਤਿਆ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ, ਸੋਨੇ ਦੇ ਗਹਿਣਿਆਂ ਲਈ ਕਿਹੜਾ ਲੋਗੋ ਵਰਤਿਆ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ ? [cite: 1600, 1614][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: The BIS Hallmark is used to certify the purity of gold jewellery. [cite: 1606]
explanation.pa: ਬੀਆਈਐਸ ਹਾਲਮਾਰਕ ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਸੋਨੇ ਦੇ ਗਹਿਣਿਆਂ ਦੀ ਸ਼ੁੱਧਤਾ ਨੂੰ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਣਿਤ ਕਰਨ ਲਈ ਕੀਤੀ ਜਾਂਦੀ ਹੈ।

text.en: Analyse the following facts and state which of the following statements is correct? Statement-1: Globalization is opening up of native/domestic economy for rest of the world mainly through foreign trade and foreign investment by Multi-National Corporations. Statement-2: A Multi-National Corporations is a business unit that operates its business activities in many different countries at the same time.
text.pa: ਹੇਠ ਲਿਖਿਆਂ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ ਕਿਹੜਾ ਕਥਨ ਸਹੀ ਹੈ ? ਕਥਨ-1 : ਵਿਸ਼ਵੀਕਰਨ ਮੁੱਖ ਤੌਰ 'ਤੇ ਬਹੁ-ਰਾਸ਼ਟਰੀ ਨਿਗਮਾਂ ਦੁਆਰਾ ਵਿਦੇਸ਼ੀ ਵਪਾਰ ਅਤੇ ਵਿਦੇਸ਼ੀ ਨਿਵੇਸ਼ ਰਾਹੀਂ ਬਾਕੀ ਦੁਨੀਆ ਲਈ ਦੇਸੀ ਘਰੇਲੂ ਅਰਥਵਿਵਸਥਾ ਨੂੰ ਖੋਲ੍ਹ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ। [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]ਕਥਨ-2 : ਇੱਕ ਬਹੁ-ਰਾਸ਼ਟਰੀ ਨਿਗਮ ਇੱਕ ਵਪਾਰਕ ਇਕਾਈ ਹੈ ਜੋ ਇੱਕੋ ਸਮੇਂ ਕਈ ਵੱਖ ਵੱਖ ਦੇਸ਼ਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਆਪਣੀਆਂ ਵਪਾਰਕ ਗਤੀਵਿਧੀਆਂ ਚਲਾਉਂਦੀ ਹੈ। [cite: 1617, 1633][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

text.en: Statement 1 is correct and Statement 2 is incorrect.
text.pa: ਕਥਨ 1 ਸਹੀ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਕਥਨ 2 ਗਲਤ ਹੈ।

text.en: Statement 1 is incorrect and Statement 2 is correct.
text.pa: ਕਥਨ 1 ਗਲਤ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਕਥਨ 2 ਸਹੀ ਹੈ।

explanation.en: Both statements accurately define Globalization and MNCs. [cite: 1627]
explanation.pa: ਦੋਵੇਂ ਕਥਨ ਵਿਸ਼ਵੀਕਰਨ ਅਤੇ ਬਹੁ-ਰਾਸ਼ਟਰੀ ਕੰਪਨੀਆਂ ਨੂੰ ਸਹੀ ਢੰਗ ਨਾਲ ਪਰਿਭਾਸ਼ਿਤ ਕਰਦੇ ਹਨ।

text.en: Primary sector also includes those sectors which use natural resources for their production. Which of the following activities is not a part of the primary sector?
text.pa: ਪ੍ਰਾਇਮਰੀ ਸੈਕਟਰ ਵਿੱਚ ਉਹ ਸੈਕਟਰ ਵੀ ਸ਼ਾਮਲ ਹਨ ਜੋ ਆਪਣੇ ਉਤਪਾਦਨ ਲਈ ਕੁਦਰਤੀ ਸਰੋਤਾਂ ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਕਰਦੇ ਹਨ। [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]ਹੇਠ ਲਿਖੀਆਂ ਗਤੀਵਿਧੀਆਂ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ ਕਿਹੜੀਆਂ ਪ੍ਰਾਇਮਰੀ ਸੈਕਟਰ ਦਾ ਹਿੱਸਾ ਨਹੀਂ ਹਨ? [cite: 1644, 1653][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: Building Construction belongs to the Secondary sector, whereas Fishing, Farming, and Dairy are Primary. [cite: 1650]
explanation.pa: ਇਮਾਰਤ ਨਿਰਮਾਣ ਸੈਕੰਡਰੀ ਸੈਕਟਰ ਨਾਲ ਸਬੰਧਤ ਹੈ, ਜਦੋਂ ਕਿ ਮੱਛੀ ਫੜਨਾ, ਖੇਤੀ ਅਤੇ ਡੇਅਰੀ ਪ੍ਰਾਇਮਰੀ ਹਨ।

text.en: The Central Bank is said to be the pivot of the banking system of any country. The first Central Bank in the world was established in Sweden in 1656 A.D. In India Central Bank was established on April 1, 1935, Name the Bank:
text.pa: ਕੇਂਦਰੀ ਬੈਂਕ ਨੂੰ ਕਿਸੇ ਵੀ ਦੇਸ਼ ਦੀ ਬੈਂਕਿੰਗ ਪ੍ਰਣਾਲੀ ਦਾ ਧੁਰਾ ਕਿਹਾ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ। ਦੁਨਿਆ ਦਾ ਪਹਿਲਾ ਕੇਂਦਰੀ ਬੈਂਕ 1656 ਈ. ਵਿੱਚ ਸਵੀਡਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਸਥਾਪਿਤ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ। ਭਾਰਤ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੇਂਦਰੀ ਬੈਂਕ 1 ਅਪ੍ਰੈਲ, 1935 ਨੂੰ ਸਥਾਪਿਤ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ । [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]ਬੈਂਕ ਦਾ ਨਾਮ ਦੱਸੋ : [cite: 1660, 1668][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) was established on April 1, 1935. [cite: 1667]
explanation.pa: ਭਾਰਤੀ ਰਿਜ਼ਰਵ ਬੈਂਕ (RBI) ਦੀ ਸਥਾਪਨਾ 1 ਅਪ੍ਰੈਲ, 1935 ਨੂੰ ਕੀਤੀ ਗਈ ਸੀ।

text.en: The matter at present is not only of development, but is to maintain the pace of the development so that the benefits will be more appropriate here of development are not only enjoyed by the present generations, but by the future generations as well. What is such development known as?
text.pa: ਇਸ ਲਈ ਵਰਤਮਾਨ ਸਮੇਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਮੁੱਦਾ ਸਿਰਫ਼ ਵਿਕਾਸ ਦਾ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੈ, ਸਗੋਂ ਵਿਕਾਸ ਦੀ ਗਤੀ ਨੂੰ ਬਣਾਈ ਰੱਖਣ ਦਾ ਹੈ ਤਾਂ ਜੋ ਵਿਕਾਸ ਦੇ ਲਾਭ ਸਿਰਫ਼ ਵਰਤਮਾਨ ਪੀੜ੍ਹੀ ਨੂੰ ਹੀ ਨਹੀਂ, ਸਗੋਂ ਆਉਣ ਵਾਲੀਆਂ ਪੀੜ੍ਹੀਆਂ ਨੂੰ ਵੀ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ ਹੋ ਸਕਣ। [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]ਅਜਿਹੇ ਵਿਕਾਸ ਨੂੰ ਕੀ ਕਿਹਾ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ ? [cite: 1677, 1685][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: Development that meets present needs without compromising future generations is called Sustainable development. [cite: 1681]
explanation.pa: ਉਹ ਵਿਕਾਸ ਜੋ ਆਉਣ ਵਾਲੀਆਂ ਪੀੜ੍ਹੀਆਂ ਨਾਲ ਸਮਝੌਤਾ ਕੀਤੇ ਬਿਨਾਂ ਮੌਜੂਦਾ ਜ਼ਰੂਰਤਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਪੂਰਾ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ, ਟਿਕਾਊ ਵਿਕਾਸ ਕਹਾਉਂਦਾ ਹੈ।

text.en: अपेक्षा-उपेक्षा' समरूपी भिन्नार्थक शब्द-युग्म के सही अर्थ का विकल्प चुनिए -
text.pa: अपेक्षा-उपेक्षा' समरूपी भिन्नार्थक शब्द-युग्म के सही अर्थ का विकल्प चुनिए -

explanation.en: Desire - Neglect.
explanation.pa: ਅਪੇਕਸ਼ਾ (ਚਾਹ/ਉਮੀਦ) - ਉਪੇਕਸ਼ਾ (ਲਾਪਰਵਾਹੀ/ਨਿਰਾਦਰ)।

text.en: If Davinder's income is Rs. 10,000 per month and he spends Rs. 7,000 every month to meet his needs. If Rs. 7,000 is his consumption expenditure, then what is the remaining sum of Rs. 3,000 known as?
text.pa: ਜੇਕਰ ਦਵਿੰਦਰ ਦੀ ਆਮਦਨ 10,000 ਰੁਪਏ ਪ੍ਰਤੀ ਮਹੀਨਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਉਹ ਆਪਣੀਆਂ ਜ਼ਰੂਰਤਾਂ ਪੂਰੀਆਂ ਕਰਨ ਲਈ ਹਰ ਮਹੀਨੇ 7,000 ਰੁਪਏ ਖਰਚ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ। [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]ਜੇਕਰ 7,000 ਰੁਪਏ ਉਸਦਾ ਖਪਤ ਖਰਚ ਹੈ ਤਾਂ ਬਾਕੀ ਬਚੇ 3,000 ਰੁਪਏ ਨੂੰ ਕੀ ਕਿਹਾ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ ? [cite: 1696, 1702]

explanation.en: Income minus Consumption equals Saving. [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]10000 - 7000 = 3000. [cite: 1699]
explanation.pa: ਆਮਦਨ ਘਟਾਓ ਖਪਤ ਬੱਚਤ ਦੇ ਬਰਾਬਰ ਹੈ। 10000 - 7000 = 3000.

text.en: Which program of India is represented by the logo given in the picture below? [Image: Logo with symbol 'อ' / Doordarshan/Digital India related]
text.pa: ਹੇਠਾਂ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਤਸਵੀਰ ਵਿੱਚ ਦਿੱਤੇ ਲੋਗੋ ਦੁਆਰਾ ਭਾਰਤ ਦੇ ਕਿਹੜੇ ਪ੍ਰੋਗਰਾਮ ਨੂੰ ਦਰਸਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ ? [cite<sub>s</sub>tart][Image: Logo] [cite: 1712, 1720][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: The question typically refers to the logo of Doordarshan (India's public service broadcaster). [cite: 1719]
explanation.pa: ਸਵਾਲ ਆਮ ਤੌਰ 'ਤੇ ਦੂਰਦਰਸ਼ਨ ਦੇ ਲੋਗੋ ਦਾ ਹਵਾਲਾ ਦਿੰਦਾ ਹੈ।

text.en: India's first passenger train was run in 1853 A.D. This first passenger train travelled from Mumbai to Thane. This train was operated by three locomotives. Name those locomotives.
text.pa: ਭਾਰਤ ਦੀ ਪਹਿਲੀ ਯਾਤਰੀ ਰੇਲਗੱਡੀ 1853 ਈ. ਵਿੱਚ ਚਲਾਈ ਗਈ ਸੀ। ਇਹ ਪਹਿਲੀ ਯਾਤਰੀ ਰੇਲਗੱਡੀ ਨੇ ਮੁੰਬਈ ਤੋਂ ਥਾਣੇ ਤੱਕ ਸਫਰ ਤੇਅ ਕੀਤਾ। ਇਸ ਰੇਲਗੱਡੀ ਨੂੰ ਤਿੰਨ ਕੋਲੇ ਵਾਲੇ ਇੰਜਣਾਂ ਨੇ ਖਿਚਿਆ ਸੀ। [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]ਉਨ੍ਹਾਂ ਕੋਲੇ ਵਾਲੇ ਇੰਜਣਾਂ ਦੇ ਨਾਮ ਦੱਸ। [cite: 1729, 1738][cite<sub>s</sub>tart]

explanation.en: The three locomotives were named Sahib, Sindh, and Sultan. [cite: 1733]
explanation.pa: ਤਿੰਨਾਂ ਇੰਜਣਾਂ ਦੇ ਨਾਂ ਸਾਹਿਬ, ਸਿੰਧ ਅਤੇ ਸੁਲਤਾਨ ਸਨ।

text.en: Author's tone in the first paragraph?
text.pa: Author's tone in the first paragraph?

explanation.en: Presents facts neutrally.
explanation.pa: Presents facts neutrally.

text.en: Which of the following statements is correct? Statement-1: Mineral is a natural element which can be organic or inorganic with some specific chemical and physical properties. Statement-2: Minerals are found in pure form on the earth's surface.
text.pa: ਹੇਠ ਲਿਖਿਆਂ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ ਕਿਹੜਾ ਕਥਨ ਸਹੀ ਹੈ? ਕਥਨ-1 : ਖਣਿਜ ਇੱਕ ਕੁਦਰਤੀ ਤੱਤ ਹੈ ਜੋ ਕੁਝ ਖਾਸ ਰਸਾਇਣਿਕ ਅਤੇ ਭੌਤਿਕ ਗੁਣਾਂ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਜੈਵਿਕ ਜਾਂ ਅਜੈਵਿਕ ਹੋ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ। [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]ਕਥਨ-2 : ਖਣਿਜ ਧਰਤੀ ਦੀ ਸਤ੍ਹਾ 'ਤੇ ਸ਼ੁੱਧ ਰੂਪ ਵਿੱਚ ਪਾਏ ਜਾਂਦੇ ਹਨ। [cite: 1764, 1776]

text.en: Statement 1 is correct and Statement 2 is incorrect.
text.pa: ਕਥਨ 1 ਸਹੀ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਕਥਨ 2 ਗਲਤ ਹੈ।

text.en: Statement 1 is incorrect and statement 2 is correct.
text.pa: ਕਥਨ 1 ਗਲਤ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਕਥਨ 2 ਸਹੀ ਹੈ।

explanation.en: Minerals are generally not found in pure form but mixed with other elements as ores. [cite<sub>s</sub>tart]Statement 1 is correct definition. [cite: 1769]
explanation.pa: ਖਣਿਜ ਆਮ ਤੌਰ 'ਤੇ ਸ਼ੁੱਧ ਰੂਪ ਵਿਚ ਨਹੀਂ ਮਿਲਦੇ ਪਰ ਦੂਜੇ ਤੱਤਾਂ ਨਾਲ ਮਿਲਾਏ ਜਾਂਦੇ ਹਨ। ਕਥਨ 1 ਸਹੀ ਪਰਿਭਾਸ਼ਾ ਹੈ।

text.en: धीर' शब्द की सही भाववाचक संज्ञा चुनिए -
text.pa: धीर' शब्द की सही भाववाचक संज्ञा चुनिए -

explanation.en: Dheerta (Patience).

text.en: Identify the shaded area in the given map of India and state which crop is mainly cultivated in this area? [Image: Map of India showing shaded area]

text.en: The number of 3-digit numbers, that are divisible by 2 and 3, but not divisible by 4 and 9, is ________.

explanation.en:
3-digit numbers divisible by 2 and 3 are multiples of 6. These range from 102 to 996.
Number of terms \( n(6) = \frac{996-102}{6} + 1 = 150 \).
We must exclude multiples of 4 (LCM(6,4)=12) and multiples of 9 (LCM(6,9)=18).
\( n(12) = \frac{996-108}{12} + 1 = 75 \).
\( n(18) = \frac{990-108}{18} + 1 = 50 \).
Intersection (multiples of LCM(12,18)=36): \( n(36) = \frac{972-108}{36} + 1 = 25 \).
Using inclusion-exclusion, numbers to exclude = \( n(12 \cup 18) = 75 + 50 - 25 = 100 \).
Final count = \( 150 - 100 = 50 \).

text.en:
Nutan Kumar is using Python connectivity with MySQL for maintaining data for a table named MEDICINES in a database PHARMACY. The table has the following attributes:

*   MId (Medicine number) - string
*   Mname (Medicine Name) - string
*   Expiry (Expiry Date) - Date
*   Status (Active/Discard) - string

Consider the following to establish connectivity between Python and MySQL:

*   Username - root
*   Password - tiger
*   Host - localhost

Help Nutan to write the definition of a user-defined function named ChangeStatus() in Python to change the Status of the Medicines whose Expiry is before '2022-12-31' as 'DISCARD'.

questions.correct_answer:
python
import mysql.connector

def ChangeStatus():
    try:
        mydb = mysql.connector.connect(
            host="localhost",
            user="root",
            password="tiger",
            database="PHARMACY"
        )
        mycursor = mydb.cursor()
        sql = "UPDATE MEDICINES SET Status = 'DISCARD' WHERE Expiry < '2022-12-31'"
        mycursor.execute(sql)
        mydb.commit()
        print(mycursor.rowcount, "record(s) updated.")
    except Exception as e:
        print("An error occurred:", e)
    finally:
        if mydb.is_connected():
            mycursor.close()
            mydb.close()

explanation.en: The function first establishes a connection to the MySQL database 'PHARMACY' using the provided credentials. It then creates a cursor object to execute SQL commands. An UPDATE query is executed to change the 'Status' to 'DISCARD' for records where the 'Expiry' date is prior to '2022-12-31'. Finally, `commit()` is called to save changes, and the connection is closed.

text.en: Write one difference of storing this data in a binary file over a CSV file.

questions.correct_answer: A binary file stores data in the same internal format that the computer uses, making it faster to read/write and more secure (not human-readable), whereas a CSV file is a plain-text format that is human-readable and can be easily edited using common text editors or spreadsheet software.

explanation.en: Binary files store data as sequences of bytes (often using serialization), which preserves the exact data structure and type. CSV files store data as text characters separated by delimiters (like commas), which involves a conversion process and lacks inherent data type protection.

text.en: Write a function, in Python, to read and display all the records from the file DOCTORS.DAT.

explanation.en: To read from a binary file in Python, the `pickle` module is used. The file is opened in 'rb' (read binary) mode. A `while True` loop with `pickle.load()` reads each record until the `EOFError` exception is caught, signifying the end of the file.

text.en: Write a function addDoctor(), in Python, which accepts a doctor's data from the user and writes it in the file DOCTORS.DAT.

questions.correct_answer:
import pickle

def addDoctor():
    doc_id = input('Enter Doctor ID: ')
    name = input('Enter Doctor Name: ')
    dept = input('Enter Department: ')
    doctor_record = [doc_id, name, dept]
    
    with open('DOCTORS.DAT', 'ab') as f:
        pickle.dump(doctor_record, f)

explanation.en: To append data to a binary file, we open it in 'ab' (append binary) mode. The function collects data inputs, stores them in a list as specified, and then uses `pickle.dump()` to serialize and write the list to the file.

text.en: A car of mass 'm' moves on a banked road having radius 'r' and banking angle \( \theta \). To avoid slipping from banked road, the maximum permissible speed of the car is \( v_0 \). The coefficient of friction \( \mu \) between the wheels of the car and the banked road is

explanation.en:
The maximum velocity on a banked road with friction is given by the formula:
\( v_0 = \sqrt{rg \left( \frac{\mu + \tan \theta}{1 - \mu \tan \theta} \right)} \)
Squaring both sides:
\( v_0^2 = rg \left( \frac{\mu + \tan \theta}{1 - \mu \tan \theta} \right) \)
\( v_0^2 (1 - \mu \tan \theta) = rg (\mu + \tan \theta) \)
\( v_0^2 - v_0^2 \mu \tan \theta = rg \mu + rg \tan \theta \)
\( v_0^2 - rg \tan \theta = \mu (rg + v_0^2 \tan \theta) \)
\( \mu = \frac{v_0^2 - rg \tan \theta}{rg + v_0^2 \tan \theta} \)

text.en: A satellite is launched into a circular orbit of radius 'R' around the earth. A second satellite is launched into an orbit of radius 1.03 R. The time period of revolution of the second satellite is larger than the first one approximately by

explanation.en:
According to Kepler's third law, the square of the time period is proportional to the cube of the radius of the orbit:
\( T^2 \propto R^3 \Rightarrow T \propto R^{3/2} \)
Using the concept of small fractional changes:
\( \frac{\Delta T}{T} \approx \frac{3}{2} \frac{\Delta R}{R} \)
Given the increase in radius is \( \Delta R = 1.03R - R = 0.03R \), so \( \frac{\Delta R}{R} = 0.03 \) or 3%.
\( \frac{\Delta T}{T} = 1.5 \times 3\% = 4.5\% \).

text.en:
An ideal gas goes from an initial state to final state. During the process, the pressure of gas increases linearly with temperature.
A. The work done by gas during the process is zero.
B. The heat added to gas is different from change in its internal energy.
C. The volume of the gas is increased.
D. The internal energy of the gas is increased.
E. The process is isochoric (constant volume process).
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:

explanation.en:
If pressure increases linearly with temperature (\( P \propto T \)), then from the ideal gas law \( PV = nRT \), the ratio \( P/T \) is constant, which implies volume \( V \) is constant.
1. Since \( V \) is constant, it is an isochoric process (Statement E is correct).
2. In an isochoric process, work done \( W = P \Delta V = 0 \) (Statement A is correct).
3. From the first law of thermodynamics, \( Q = \Delta U + W \). Since \( W = 0 \), \( Q = \Delta U \). Thus, statement B is incorrect.
4. As temperature increases, internal energy \( U \) (which depends on temperature for an ideal gas) also increases (Statement D is correct).
5. Volume is constant, so statement C is incorrect.
Therefore, statements A, D, and E are correct.

text.en: An electron of mass 'm' with an initial velocity \( \vec{v} = v_0 \hat{i} \) (\( v_0 > 0 \)) enters an electric field \( \vec{E} = -E_0 \hat{k} \). If the initial de Broglie wavelength is \( \lambda_0 \), the value after time t would be

explanation.en:
Initial wavelength \( \lambda_0 = \frac{h}{mv_0} \).
The force on the electron is \( \vec{F} = -e\vec{E} = -e(-E_0 \hat{k}) = eE_0 \hat{k} \).
Acceleration \( \vec{a} = \frac{eE_0}{m} \hat{k} \).
Velocity at time \( t \) is \( \vec{v}(t) = v_0 \hat{i} + \left(\frac{eE_0 t}{m}\right) \hat{k} \).
The speed is \( v = |\vec{v}(t)| = \sqrt{v_0^2 + \left(\frac{eE_0 t}{m}\right)^2} = v_0 \sqrt{1 + \frac{e^2 E_0^2 t^2}{m^2 v_0^2}} \).
The de Broglie wavelength at time \( t \) is:
\( \lambda = \frac{h}{mv} = \frac{h}{mv_0 \sqrt{1 + \frac{e^2 E_0^2 t^2}{m^2 v_0^2}}} = \frac{\lambda_0}{\sqrt{1 + \frac{e^2 E_0^2 t^2}{m^2 v_0^2}}} \).

text.en: What is the relative decrease in focal length of a lens for an increase in optical power by 0.1 D from 2.5 D? ['D' stands for dioptre]

explanation.en:
Optical power \( P \) and focal length \( f \) are related by \( P = \frac{1}{f} \).
Taking relative change (differentials):
\( dP = -\frac{1}{f^2} df \)
Dividing by \( P = \frac{1}{f} \):
\( \frac{dP}{P} = -\frac{df}{f} \)
The relative decrease in focal length \( \left| \frac{df}{f} \right| = \frac{\Delta P}{P} \).
Given \( \Delta P = 0.1 \, \text{D} \) and \( P = 2.5 \, \text{D} \):
Relative decrease \( = \frac{0.1}{2.5} = \frac{1}{25} = 0.04 \).

text.en: A force \( F = \alpha + \beta x^2 \) acts on an object in the x-direction. The work done by the force is 5 J when the object is displaced by 1 m. If the constant \( \alpha = 1 \, \text{N} \) then \( \beta \) will be

explanation.en:
Work done \( W = \int F \, dx \).
Assuming the object is displaced from \( x = 0 \) to \( x = 1 \, \text{m} \):
\( W = \int_{0}^{1} (\alpha + \beta x^2) \, dx = [\alpha x + \frac{\beta x^3}{3}]_{0}^{1} = \alpha + \frac{\beta}{3} \)
Given \( W = 5 \, \text{J} \) and \( \alpha = 1 \, \text{N} \):
\( 5 = 1 + \frac{\beta}{3} \)
\( 4 = \frac{\beta}{3} \Rightarrow \beta = 12 \, \text{N/m}^2 \).

text.en: Let $y = y(x)$ be the solution of the differential equation $\left( xy - 5x^2\sqrt{1+x^2} \right) dx + \left( 1+x^2 \right) dy = 0, y(0) = 0$. Then $y(\sqrt{3})$ is equal to

explanation.en:
The DE is linear: $\frac{dy}{dx} + \frac{x}{1+x^2} y = \frac{5x^2}{\sqrt{1+x^2}}$. The integrating factor is $I(x) = \sqrt{1+x^2}$.
$y \sqrt{1+x^2} = \int 5x^2 dx + C = 5x^3/3 + C$.
Using $y(0)=0$, we get $C=0$.
$y(x) = \frac{5x^3}{3\sqrt{1+x^2}}$.
$y(\sqrt{3}) = \frac{5(\sqrt{3})^3}{3\sqrt{1+3}} = \frac{15\sqrt{3}}{6} = \frac{5\sqrt{3}}{2}$.

text.en:
For the given cell \( Fe^{2+}_{(aq)} + Ag^+_{(aq)} \rightarrow Fe^{3+}_{(aq)} + Ag_{(s)} \). The standard cell potential of the above reaction is found from the following data:
\( Ag^+ + e^- \rightarrow Ag \quad E^o = x V \)
Given:
\( Fe^{2+} + 2e^- \rightarrow Fe \quad E^o = y V \)
\( Fe^{3+} + 3e^- \rightarrow Fe \quad E^o = z V \)

explanation.en:
To find the standard cell potential (\( E^o_{cell} \)) for the reaction \( Fe^{2+} + Ag^+ \rightarrow Fe^{3+} + Ag \):
1. \( E^o_{cell} = E^o_{cathode} - E^o_{anode} = E^o(Ag^+/Ag) - E^o(Fe^{3+}/Fe^{2+}) \).
2. Given \( E^o(Ag^+/Ag) = x V \).
3. To find \( E^o(Fe^{3+}/Fe^{2+}) \), use \( \Delta G^o = -nFE^o \):
    a) \( Fe^{2+} + 2e^- \rightarrow Fe \quad \Delta G_1^o = -2Fy \)
    b) \( Fe^{3+} + 3e^- \rightarrow Fe \quad \Delta G_2^o = -3Fz \)
    c) For \( Fe^{3+} + e^- \rightarrow Fe^{2+} \): \( \Delta G_3^o = \Delta G_2^o - \Delta G_1^o = -3Fz - (-2Fy) = 2Fy - 3Fz \)
    d) \( -1 \cdot F \cdot E^o(Fe^{3+}/Fe^{2+}) = 2Fy - 3Fz \Rightarrow E^o(Fe^{3+}/Fe^{2+}) = 3z - 2y \).
4. \( E^o_{cell} = x - (3z - 2y) = x + 2y - 3z \).

text.en: The large difference between the melting and boiling points of oxygen and sulphur may be explained on the basis of

explanation.en: Oxygen exists as diatomic \( O_2 \) molecules, whereas sulphur exists as polyatomic \( S_8 \) rings. This difference in atomicity leads to much stronger London dispersion forces (Van der Waals forces) in sulphur due to its larger molecular size and more electrons, resulting in significantly higher melting and boiling points compared to oxygen.

1. **Actual Quantity (AQ) used** = Opening Stock + Purchases - Closing Stock = \( 0 + 3,000 - 500 = 2,500 \) units.
2. **Actual Price (AP)** = \( rac{ ext{Value of materials purchased}}{ ext{Quantity purchased}} = rac{9,000}{3,000} = ₹ 3 \) per unit.
3. **Standard Quantity (SQ)** for actual output = \( ext{Output} imes ext{Standard rate per ton} = 80 ext{ tons} imes 30 ext{ units/ton} = 2,400 \) units.
4. **Standard Price (SP)** = \( ₹ 2.50 \) per unit.
5. **Material Cost Variance (MCV)** = \( (SQ imes SP) - (AQ imes AP) = (2,400 imes 2.50) - (2,500 imes 3.00) = 6,000 - 7,500 = -1,500 \).
Therefore, MCV = \( ₹ 1,500 ext{ (Adverse)} \).

model_answer.en: ₹ 1,500 (Adverse)

explanation.en:
Material Price Variance (MPV) = \( ext{Actual Quantity Used} imes (SP - AP) \)
\( MPV = 2,500 imes (2.50 - 3.00) = 2,500 imes (-0.50) = -1,250 \).
Therefore, MPV = \( ₹ 1,250 ext{ (Adverse)} \).
(Note: If calculated on materials purchased, MPV = \( 3,000 imes (2.50 - 3.00) = ₹ 1,500 ext{ (A)} \)).

model_answer.en: ₹ 1,250 (Adverse)

explanation.en:
Material Usage Variance (MUV) = \( SP imes (SQ - AQ) \)

\( MUV = 2.50 imes (2,400 - 2,500) = 2.50 imes (-100) = -250 \).

Therefore, MUV = \( ₹250 ext{ (Adverse)} \).

model_answer.en: ₹ 250 (Adverse)

text.en: Explain how effective delegation and decentralization have contributed to the success of McDonald's global operations or a franchise based model.

explanation.en: The question tests understanding of organizational structure. Delegation refers to the transfer of authority from a manager to a subordinate, while decentralization is the systematic dispersal of authority throughout the organization.

model_answer.en:
Model Answer: Delegation and decentralization are foundational to the McDonald's franchise model.
1. **Local Empowerment**: Delegation allows individual franchisees to manage day-to-day operations, staffing, and local marketing, fostering an entrepreneurial spirit within a corporate framework.
2. **Market Adaptation**: Decentralization enables the brand to adapt its product offerings to local cultural tastes (e.g., localized menus like the Maharaja Mac in India) while maintaining global quality standards.
3. **Agility**: Decision-making at the local level ensures faster responses to regional competition and customer needs, leading to sustainable global growth.

text.pa: For a statistical data $x_1, x_2, \ldots, x_{10}$ of 10 values, a student obtained the mean as $5.5$ and $\sum_{i=1}^{10} x_i^2 = 371$. He later found that he had noted two values in the data incorrectly as 4 and 5, instead of the correct values 6 and 8 respectively. The variance of the corrected data is

explanation.en:
Original data: $N=10$, $ar{x}_{old} = 5.5$, $\sum x_i^2{}_{old} = 371$. $\sum x_i{}_{old} = N ar{x}_{old} = 10 times 5.5 = 55$. 

Incorrect values: 4 and 5. Correct values: 6 and 8. Sum of corrected data: $\sum x_i{}_{new} = \sum x_i{}_{old} - 4 - 5 + 6 + 8 = 55 - 9 + 14 = 60$. Mean of corrected data: $ar{x}_{new} = rac{60}{10} = 6$.

 Sum of squares of corrected data: $\sum x_i^2{}_{new} = \sum x_i^2{}_{old} - 4^2 - 5^2 + 6^2 + 8^2 = 371 - 16 - 25 + 36 + 64 = 371 - 41 + 100 = 430$. Variance of corrected data: $\sigma^2{}_{new} = rac{\sum x_i^2{}_{new}}{N} - (ar{x}_{new})^2 = rac{430}{10} - 6^2 = 43 - 36 = 7$. Wait, let's recheck the options and calculation. Option (2) is 5.

 Recalculating $\sum x_i^2{}_{new}$: $371 - (16+25) + (36+64) = 371 - 41 + 100 = 430$. $\sigma^2{}_{new} = 43 - 36 = 7$. If the correct variance is 7, it should be option (3). Let's re-examine the options given in the image for Q10: (1) 9, (2) 5, (3) 7, (4) 4. 

Since 7 is an option, the correct answer is (3) 7. (The displayed options in the text are (1) 9, (2) 5, (3) 7, (4) 4. The key seems to indicate (2) 5 or maybe my calculation is wrong or the intended answer key is wrong.) Let's assume the calculated value $\sigma^2 = 7$ is correct based on the problem statement. Thus, Option (3) is correct. If we select option (2) 5: $43 - 36 = 7$. None of the common errors lead to 5 easily. Sticking to the calculation: Correct variance is 7.

text.en:
Which of the following statements are NOT true about the periodic table?
A. The properties of elements are function of atomic weights.
B. The properties of elements are function of atomic numbers.
C. Elements having similar outer electronic configurations are arranged in same period.
D. An element's location reflects the quantum numbers of the last filled orbital.
E. The number of elements in a period is same as the number of atomic orbitals available in energy level that is being filled.
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:

explanation.en:
Statement A is NOT true for the modern periodic table (Modern Periodic Law states properties are functions of atomic numbers).
Statement C is NOT true because elements with similar outer electronic configurations are placed in the same group, not period.
Statement E is NOT true because the number of elements in a period is twice the number of atomic orbitals available (as each orbital can hold 2 electrons).
Statements B and D are correct descriptions of the modern periodic table.

text.en:
Given below are two statements I and II.
Statement I: Dumas method is used for estimation of "Nitrogen" in an organic compound.
Statement II: Dumas method involves the formation of ammonium sulphate by heating the organic compound with conc \( H_2SO_4 \).
In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
(1) Statement I is true but Statement II is false
(2) Both Statement I and Statement II are false
(3) Statement I is false but Statement II is true
(4) Both Statement I and Statement II are true

explanation.en:
Statement I is true: The Dumas method is a standard analytical technique for nitrogen estimation.
Statement II is false: The description given (heating with conc. \( H_2SO_4 \) to form ammonium sulphate) refers to the Kjeldahl method. The Dumas method involves heating the compound with copper(II) oxide to produce nitrogen gas.

text.en:
Which of the following statement is true with respect to \( H_2O, NH_3 \) and \( CH_4 \) ?
A. The central atoms of all the molecules are \( sp^3 \) hybridized.
B. The \( H - O - H, H - N - H \) and \( H - C - H \) angles in the above molecules are \( 104.5^\circ, 107.5^\circ \) and \( 109.5^\circ \), respectively.
C. The increasing order of dipole moment is \( CH_4 < NH_3 < H_2O \).
D. Both \( H_2O \) and \( NH_3 \) are Lewis acids and \( CH_4 \) is a Lewis base.
E. A solution of \( NH_3 \) in \( H_2O \) is basic. In this solution \( NH_3 \) and \( H_2O \) act as Lowry-Bronsted acid and base respectively.
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
(4) A, B, C and E Only

explanation.en:
A: True, the central atoms (O, N, C) all have four electron domains and are \( sp^3 \) hybridized.
B: True, due to lone pair-bond pair repulsions, the bond angles decrease from the tetrahedral \( 109.5^\circ \) in \( CH_4 \) to \( 107.5^\circ \) in \( NH_3 \) (1 lone pair) and \( 104.5^\circ \) in \( H_2O \) (2 lone pairs).
C: True, \( CH_4 \) is non-polar (0 D), while \( H_2O \) is more polar than \( NH_3 \) due to higher electronegativity of oxygen and the geometry of lone pairs.
D: False, \( H_2O \) and \( NH_3 \) are Lewis bases due to lone pairs.
E: False, in aqueous ammonia, \( NH_3 \) acts as a Brønsted base (proton acceptor) and \( H_2O \) acts as a Brønsted acid (proton donor).

text.en: Which one of the carbocations from the following is most stable? [IMAGE]

explanation.en:
Stability in these allylic carbocations is determined by the extent of resonance and inductive effects. In option (2), the positive charge is delocalized through the double bond to the carbon adjacent to the oxygen atom. The lone pair on oxygen then provides significant stabilization through the \( +M \) (mesomeric) effect, creating a resonance structure where every atom has a complete octet:
\( \overset{+}{\text{CH}}_2-\text{CH}=\text{CH}-\text{O}-\text{CH}_3 \leftrightarrow \text{CH}_2=\text{CH}-\overset{+}{\text{CH}}-\text{O}-\text{CH}_3 \leftrightarrow \text{CH}_2=\text{CH}-\text{CH}=\overset{+}{\text{O}}-\text{CH}_3 \).
In option (4), the ester oxygen's lone pair is cross-conjugated with the carbonyl group, reducing its ability to stabilize the carbocation. Option (1) has the oxygen separated by a \( \text{CH}_2 \) group, so no mesomeric stabilization is possible.

text.en: Let \( f : \mathbb{R} - \{0\} \to \mathbb{R} \) be a function such that \( f(x) - 6f(\frac{1}{x}) = \frac{35}{x} - 5 \). If the \( \lim_{x \to 0} ( \frac{1}{\alpha x} + f(x) ) = \beta ; \alpha, \beta \in \mathbb{R} \), then \( \alpha + 2\beta \) is equal to
text.pa: Let \( f : \mathbb{R} - \{0\} \to \mathbb{R} \) be a function such that \( f(x) - 6f(\frac{1}{x}) = \frac{35}{x} - 5 \). If the \( \lim_{x \to 0} ( \frac{1}{\alpha x} + f(x) ) = \beta ; \alpha, \beta \in \mathbb{R} \), then \( \alpha + 2\beta \) is equal to

explanation.en:
Given: \( f(x) - 6f(1/x) = 35/x - 5 \) --- (i)
Replacing \( x \) by \( 1/x \): \( f(1/x) - 6f(x) = 35x - 5 \) --- (ii)
Multiply (ii) by 6 and add to (i):
\( -35f(x) = 35/x + 210x - 35 \Rightarrow f(x) = -1/x - 6x + 1 \).
Limit: \( \lim_{x \to 0} (\frac{1}{\alpha x} - \frac{1}{x} - 6x + 1) = \beta \).
For limit to exist, \( 1/\alpha - 1 = 0 \Rightarrow \alpha = 1 \). Then \( \beta = 1 \).
\( \alpha + 2\beta = 1 + 2(1) = 3 \).

text.pa: Let the lines \( 3x - 4y - \alpha = 0, 8x - 11y - 33 = 0 \), and \( 2x - 3y + \lambda = 0 \) be concurrent. If the image of the point \( (1, 2) \) in the line \( 2x - 3y + \lambda = 0 \) is \( (\frac{57}{13}, -\frac{40}{13}) \), then \( \alpha\lambda \) is equal to

explanation.en:
The image formula for point \( (x_1, y_1) \) in line \( ax+by+c=0 \) is \( \frac{x-x_1}{a} = \frac{y-y_1}{b} = \frac{-2(ax_1+by_1+c)}{a^2+b^2} \).
For point \( (1, 2) \) and line \( 2x-3y+\lambda=0 \), the image is given as \( (57/13, -40/13) \).
Midpoint \( (\frac{1 + 57/13}{2}, \frac{2 - 40/13}{2}) = (\frac{70}{26}, \frac{-14}{26}) = (\frac{35}{13}, -\frac{7}{13}) \) must lie on the line.
\( 2(\frac{35}{13}) - 3(-\frac{7}{13}) + \lambda = 0 \Rightarrow \frac{70+21}{13} + \lambda = 0 \Rightarrow \lambda = -7 \).
Now the lines are concurrent:
\( \begin{vmatrix} 3 & -4 & -\alpha \\ 8 & -11 & -33 \\ 2 & -3 & -7 \end{vmatrix} = 0 \).
Expanding: \( 3(77-99) + 4(-56+66) - \alpha(-24+22) = 0 \).
\( 3(-22) + 4(10) + 2\alpha = 0 \Rightarrow -66 + 40 + 2\alpha = 0 \Rightarrow 2\alpha = 26 \Rightarrow \alpha = 13 \).
\( |\alpha\lambda| = |13 \times (-7)| = |-91| = 91 \). Or simply \( \alpha\lambda = -91 \). If asking for product magnitude or just value. Let's check options. Option 3 is 91.

The given circle is \( (x-1)^2 + (y+2)^2 = 9 \) with centre \( C_1(1, -2) \) and radius \( R=3 \).
The centre of circle \( C \) is the image of \( C_1 \) in the line \( 2x - 3y + 5 = 0 \).
Using image formula: \( \frac{x-1}{2} = \frac{y+2}{-3} = -2\frac{2(1)-3(-2)+5}{4+9} = -2 \).
So, \( x = -3 \) and \( y = 4 \). The centre of \( C \) is \( O(-3, 4) \).
Point \( A \) is on the right of \( O \) and \( OA \parallel x \)-axis, so \( A = (-3+3, 4) = (0, 4) \).
Arc length \( AB = \frac{1}{6} \times 2\pi R \) implies the angle subtended is \( 60^\circ \).
Coordinates of \( B = (-3 + 3\cos\theta, 4 + 3\sin\theta) \) where \( \theta = \pm 60^\circ \).
Given \( \beta < 4 \), we choose \( \theta = -60^\circ \).
\( \alpha = -3 + 3\cos(-60^\circ) = -1.5 \) and \( \beta = 4 + 3\sin(-60^\circ) = 4 - 1.5\sqrt{3} \).
Thus, \( \beta - \sqrt{3}\alpha = (4 - 1.5\sqrt{3}) - \sqrt{3}(-1.5) = 4 \).

text.en: Let \( \vec{a} = \hat{i} + 2\hat{j} + 3\hat{k} \), \( \vec{b} = 3\hat{i} + \hat{j} - \hat{k} \) and \( \vec{c} \) be three vectors such that \( \vec{c} \) is coplanar with \( \vec{a} \) and \( \vec{b} \). If the vector \( \vec{c} \) is perpendicular to \( \vec{b} \) and \( \vec{a} \cdot \vec{c} = 5 \), then \( |\vec{c}| \) is equal to
text.pa: Let \( \vec{a} = \hat{i} + 2\hat{j} + 3\hat{k} \), \( \vec{b} = 3\hat{i} + \hat{j} - \hat{k} \) and \( \vec{c} \) be three vectors such that \( \vec{c} \) is coplanar with \( \vec{a} \) and \( \vec{b} \). If the vector \( \vec{c} \) is perpendicular to \( \vec{b} \) and \( \vec{a} \cdot \vec{c} = 5 \), then \( |\vec{c}| \) is equal to

explanation.en:
Since \( \vec{c} \) is coplanar with \( \vec{a} \) and \( \vec{b} \) and perpendicular to \( \vec{b} \), it is parallel to \( \vec{b} \times (\vec{a} \times \vec{b}) \).
\( \vec{b} \times (\vec{a} \times \vec{b}) = (\vec{b} \cdot \vec{b})\vec{a} - (\vec{b} \cdot \vec{a})\vec{b} \).
\( |\vec{b}|^2 = 3^2 + 1^2 + (-1)^2 = 11 \).
\( \vec{a} \cdot \vec{b} = (1)(3) + (2)(1) + (3)(-1) = 2 \).
So, \( \vec{v} = 11(\hat{i} + 2\hat{j} + 3\hat{k}) - 2(3\hat{i} + \hat{j} - \hat{k}) = 5\hat{i} + 20\hat{j} + 35\hat{k} = 5(\hat{i} + 4\hat{j} + 7\hat{k}) \).
Let \( \vec{c} = \lambda (\hat{i} + 4\hat{j} + 7\hat{k}) \).
Given \( \vec{a} \cdot \vec{c} = 5 \Rightarrow \lambda(1 + 8 + 21) = 5 \Rightarrow 30\lambda = 5 \Rightarrow \lambda = 1/6 \).
Then \( |\vec{c}|^2 = (1/6)^2 (1^2 + 4^2 + 7^2) = \frac{66}{36} = \frac{11}{6} \).
Therefore, \( |\vec{c}| = \sqrt{11/6} \).

text.en: Let \( L \) be a language over the alphabet \( \{a, b\} \) such that \( L = \{ w \in \{a, b\}^* \mid w 	ext{ has an equal number of substrings "ab" and "ba" } \} \). Is \( L \) regular, context-free, or neither? Justify your answer.

questions.correct_answer: The language \( L \) is regular. A string \( w \) has an equal number of "ab" and "ba" substrings if and only if the first character of the string is the same as the last character of the string (or if the string length is \( < 2 \)). This property can be checked by a Finite Automaton (DFA) with a constant number of states, specifically tracking the first character seen and the current last character.

explanation.en: The occurrences of 'ab' and 'ba' alternate as we scan the string. 'ab' transitions the state from 'ending in a' to 'ending in b', and 'ba' transitions it back. For the counts to be equal, the string must 'return' to its starting character state. Since this can be represented by a DFA, the language is regular.

text.en: Distinguish between cycles and circuits in both directed and undirected graphs. Explain how the detection of these structures varies depending on graph type and representation. Also explain how cycle detection plays a critical role in applications such as deadlock detection, scheduling, and electronic circuit design.

questions.correct_answer:
A **cycle** is a path that starts and ends at the same vertex with no repeated vertices other than the start/end. A **circuit** is a closed trail (starts and ends at the same vertex and repeats no edges), but it may repeat vertices.
Detection: In undirected graphs, DFS can detect cycles if it encounters an already visited vertex that is not the parent. In directed graphs, DFS uses a recursion stack to detect back-edges.
Applications:
1. **Deadlock Detection**: In a Resource Allocation Graph, a cycle indicates a circular wait, implying a deadlock.
2. **Scheduling**: Tasks are represented as DAGs; cycle detection ensures there are no circular dependencies.
3. **Electronic Circuit Design**: Feedback loops (cycles) are essential for memory elements (latches) but must be avoided in combinational logic to prevent oscillations.

explanation.en: Cycle detection is a fundamental graph algorithm. The complexity is usually \( O(V+E) \) using adjacency lists. The distinction between simple cycles and general circuits is key in Eulerian vs Hamiltonian path problems.

text.en: Explain the end-to-end principle in network design. Evaluate its impact on the evolution of the Internet architecture and its interaction with middleboxes such as NATs and firewalls. Discuss how the proliferation of these intermediaries devices challenges the principle, and critically assess whether the modern Internet still adheres to the end-to-end philosophy. Reflect on the future implications of this shift for protocol design and innovation.

questions.correct_answer:
The **end-to-end principle** states that network functions should only be implemented in the intermediate nodes of a network if they can be completely and correctly implemented there; otherwise, they should be implemented at the end hosts.
Impact: It led to a simple, 'dumb' network core that allowed rapid innovation at the edges.
Middleboxes: NATs and firewalls break this by maintaining per-flow state and modifying headers in the core.
Assessment: The modern internet has drifted from this principle due to security (firewalls) and address exhaustion (NAT). This 'ossification' makes it hard to deploy new transport protocols (like QUIC, which tunnels over UDP to bypass middlebox restrictions).
Future: Protocol design is increasingly moving towards encryption (TLS) to hide header info from middleboxes, effectively trying to restore end-to-end transparency.

explanation.en: This principle was formalized by Saltzer, Reed, and Clark in 1984. The shift towards 'middlebox-heavy' networks is a major topic in modern network research, often discussed in the context of SDN and NFV.

text.en: Python supports multiple programming paradigms – procedural, object-oriented, and functional. Critically evaluate how Python achieves this flexibility, and discuss the design consequences of supporting such diverse paradigms. How do these features influence maintainability, performance, and software architecture, particularly in large-scale systems or collaborative development environments?

questions.correct_answer:
Python achieves multi-paradigm support through its dynamic nature and 'everything is an object' model.
1. **Procedural**: Supported via top-level script execution and functions.
2. **OO**: Supported via classes, inheritance, and polymorphism where even basic types are objects.
3. **Functional**: Supported via first-class functions, anonymous functions (lambda), and built-ins like map, filter, and reduce.
Consequences: Flexibility allows developers to choose the best tool for a task but can lead to inconsistent codebases. Performance is impacted by the overhead of dynamic dispatch and the Global Interpreter Lock (GIL). Maintainability in large systems requires strict linting and type hinting to manage the 'messiness' that multi-paradigm freedom can create.

explanation.en: Python's design philosophy (PEP 20) emphasizes readability. While it's multi-paradigm, it often favors 'one obvious way to do it,' though functional and OO features often provide multiple ways. The trade-off is often developer productivity vs execution speed.

text.en: Python's module and package system enables scalable and modular software development. Analyze how the import mechanism, namespace resolution, and module caching contribute to both power and pitfalls in real-world Python applications. In what ways can improper use of modules hinder maintainability and introduce hard-to-detect bugs? Suggest best practices to mitigate such issues.

questions.correct_answer:
Model Answer: 
1. Import Mechanism: Uses 'sys.path' to locate modules. Pitfall: Namespace shadowing if local files have same names as libraries. 
2. Namespace Resolution: LEGB rule. Pitfall: Overuse of 'from module import *' pollutes global namespace.
3. Module Caching: 'sys.modules' prevents re-execution. Pitfall: Circular imports or issues when modifying modules at runtime.
4. Bugs/Maintainability: Hard-to-track dependencies, monkey-patching risks.
5. Best Practices: Use absolute imports, avoid wildcard imports, keep modules focused (SRP), and use virtual environments.

explanation.en: This question tests deep understanding of Python internals regarding code organization and execution. It focuses on the trade-offs between Python's flexible dynamic nature and the resulting risks in large-scale software engineering.

Energy conservation for transitions: \( E_{AC} = E_{AB} + E_{BC} \).
Using \( E = \frac{hc}{\lambda} \):
\( \frac{1}{\lambda_{AC}} = \frac{1}{\lambda_{AB}} + \frac{1}{\lambda_{BC}} \).
\( \frac{1}{2000} = \frac{1}{\lambda_{AB}} + \frac{1}{6000} \).
\( \frac{1}{\lambda_{AB}} = \frac{1}{2000} - \frac{1}{6000} = \frac{3-1}{6000} = \frac{2}{6000} = \frac{1}{3000} \).
So, \( \lambda_{AB} = 3000 \text{ \AA} \).

text.en:
Consider a programming language that allows nested comments in the following format:
comments begin with “(*” and end with “*)”, and they may be arbitrarily nested (i.e., a comment may contain another properly formed comment). For example, “(* comment (* nested *) still in comment *)” is valid. Write a detailed justification of whether such a language feature can be handled by a regular expression-based lexical analyzer (i.e., finite automata), or if a more powerful mechanism is required. Explain your reasoning based on formal language theory.

questions.correct_answer: A more powerful mechanism (specifically a Context-Free Grammar or a Pushdown Automaton) is required. Regular languages, which are recognized by Finite Automata, cannot handle nested structures because they lack a mechanism (like a stack) to count or 'remember' the depth of nesting. Formal language theory's Pumping Lemma for regular languages can be used to prove that the language of balanced/nested parentheses is not regular.

explanation.en: Nested structures require memory to keep track of opening delimiters to match them with closing ones. Since a Finite Automaton has a finite number of states, it cannot track an arbitrary depth of nesting. This is a classic example of a context-free language that is not regular.

text.en: Let L be a language over the alphabet {a, b} such that \( L = \{ w \in \{a, b\} \mid w \text{ has an equal number of substrings “ab” and “ba”} \} \). Is L regular, context-free, or neither? Justify your answer.

questions.correct_answer: The language L is regular. A string has an equal number of "ab" and "ba" substrings if and only if it starts and ends with the same character (e.g., starts with 'a' and ends with 'a', or starts with 'b' and ends with 'b') or if the string has length less than 2. This condition can be easily checked by a Finite Automaton with a small number of states.

explanation.en: Every 'ab' must eventually be followed by a 'ba' to return to an 'a' state, and vice versa. If a string starts with 'a' and ends with 'a', any transition to 'b' (creating 'ab') must eventually be balanced by a transition back to 'a' (creating 'ba'). Thus, the count of 'ab' and 'ba' will differ by at most 1, and will be equal if the first and last characters are the same.

text.en: Distinguish between cycles and circuits in both directed and undirected graphs. Explain how the detection of these structures varies depending on graph type and representation. Also explain how cycle detection plays a critical role in applications such as deadlock detection, scheduling, and electronic circuit design.

questions.correct_answer: A cycle is a path where only the first and last vertices are equal, with no repeated edges or vertices. A circuit is a closed trail (starts and ends at the same vertex) where edges cannot repeat, but vertices can. Detection: In undirected graphs, DFS can detect cycles via back-edges to any visited vertex (excluding the parent). In directed graphs, a back-edge must point to an ancestor in the current recursion stack. Applications: Deadlock detection uses cycles in Wait-For-Graphs; Scheduling uses DAGs (Directed Acyclic Graphs) to ensure no circular dependencies; Circuit design uses cycle detection to find feedback loops.

explanation.en: The primary difference lies in the restriction of repeated vertices. Detection algorithms like DFS or Kahn's algorithm (for DAGs) are fundamental. In deadlocks, a cycle indicates a circular wait condition.

text.en: Explain the end-to-end principle in network design. Evaluate its impact on the evolution of the Internet architecture and its interaction with middleboxes such as NATs and firewalls. Discuss how the proliferation of these intermediaries challenges the principle, and critically assess whether the modern Internet still adheres to the end-to-end philosophy. Reflect on the future implications of this shift for protocol design and innovation.

questions.correct_answer: The end-to-end principle suggests that network functions should be implemented in the end hosts rather than the network core, unless they can be completely and correctly implemented only within the network. It fostered innovation by keeping the core simple (IP). Middleboxes (NAT, Firewalls) break this by inspecting/altering state, making the network 'opaque'. While they provide security and address conservation, they complicate new protocol deployment (e.g., QUIC, IPv6). The modern Internet is a hybrid, drifting away from the pure principle for pragmatic reasons.

explanation.en: The principle was coined by Saltzer, Reed, and Clark. Middleboxes introduce 'ossification' where the network core becomes rigid and assumes specific protocol behaviors (like TCP/UDP port mapping), hindering the introduction of new transport protocols.

text.en: Python supports multiple programming paradigms – procedural, object-oriented, and functional. Critically evaluate how Python achieves this flexibility, and discuss the design consequences of supporting such diverse paradigms. How do these features influence maintainability, performance, and software architecture, particularly in large-scale systems or collaborative development environments?

questions.correct_answer: Python achieves multi-paradigm support through its 'everything is an object' model and dynamic typing. Procedural code is supported via top-level execution and functions; OOP via a robust class system with multiple inheritance; Functional via first-class functions, lambdas, and built-ins like map/filter/reduce. Consequences: High flexibility can lead to inconsistent code styles in large teams. Performance may suffer due to the overhead of supporting dynamic features. Maintainability is enhanced by choosing the 'right tool' for a specific module but requires strict style guides (PEP 8).

explanation.en: Python's flexibility allows developers to write quick scripts (procedural) or complex systems (OOP). Functional features encourage concise, side-effect-free logic. However, the lack of static enforcement and the Global Interpreter Lock (GIL) are trade-offs for this high-level abstraction.

text.en:
Consider two cache organizations: The first one is 32KB 2-way set-associative with 32B block size. The second one is of the same size but direct mapped. The size of an address is 32 bits in both cases. A 2x1 multiplexer has latency of 0.6 ns while a k-bit comparator has a latency of k/10 ns. Find out the hit latency of the set-associative and direct-mapped memory organizations.
Consider another setting of the 2-way set-associative cache having 128 lines, each with 16 words. Suppose the main memory has 16-bit address. Both cache and memory are word addressable. Now suppose we want to read and write a word at memory address 357A. Under this, another set associative mapping technique, what will be the "tag" value in decimal?

questions.correct_answer: Hit Latency (Direct Mapped) = 1.7 ns; Hit Latency (2-way) = 2.4 ns; Tag value (decimal) = 13

explanation.en:
1. **Hit Latency Calculation**:
- **Direct Mapped**: Block size 32B (5 bits offset). Lines = 32KB / 32B = 1024 (10 bits index). Tag = 32 - 10 - 5 = 17 bits. Latency = Tag comparison = 17/10 = 1.7 ns.
- **2-way Set Associative**: Sets = 1024/2 = 512 (9 bits index). Tag = 32 - 9 - 5 = 18 bits. Latency = Comparator + Mux = 1.8 + 0.6 = 2.4 ns.
2. **Tag Value Calculation**:
- Cache has 128 lines, 16 words/line, 2-way. Sets = 128/2 = 64 (6 bits set index). Word offset = 4 bits (\( \log_2 16 \)). Tag = 16 - 6 - 4 = 6 bits.
- Memory address \( 357A_{16} = 0011 0101 0111 1010_2 \).
- Binary mapping: [Tag: 001101] [Index: 010101] [Offset: 1010].
- Tag = \( 001101_2 = 13_{10} \).

text.en: Using the decision parameter of Bresenham line drawing algorithm for line with slope <1, find the coordinates of the points that lie on line with end points (1, 1) and (7, 5).

Differentiate between Immediate and Deferred Log-based recovery methods. Generate the log file of below given (Figure 1) transaction using both Immediate and Deferred recovery methods. Also state, if the failure happens in T1 before commit, what will happen in both Immediate and Deferred recovery methods? In Figure 2, which one of the two Log-based recovery methods (Immediate or Deferred) is used to generate the file? If crash happens now (after T3 is written to file), and system tries to recover both undo and redo operations also, which transaction will go to each of undo and redo list?

Figure 1:
Transaction T1
R(A)
A=A-100
W(A)
R(B)
B=B+200
W(B)
Commit

Figure 2:
File
<T4, Start>
<T4, Y, 2, 3>
<T1, Start>
<T4, Commit>
<T1, Z, 5, 7>
Checkpoint
<T2, Start>
<T2, X, 1, 9>
<T2, Commit>
<T3, Start>
<T3, Z, 7, 2>

[IMAGE]

questions.correct_answer:
1. **Difference**: Immediate update writes to disk immediately; Deferred waits for commit.
2. **Failure before commit**: Deferred - ignore log; Immediate - UNDO T1.
3. **Figure 2**: Uses Immediate recovery (contains old and new values).
4. **Recovery Lists**: Redo List = {T1, T2}, Undo List = {T3}.

explanation.en:
1. **Log Generation**: Deferred update log contains \( \langle T, X, V_{new} angle \). Immediate update log contains \( \langle T, X, V_{old}, V_{new} angle \).
2. **Figure 2 Analysis**: Records like \( \langle T4, Y, 2, 3 angle \) show both old value (2) and new value (3), which is characteristic of the Immediate Update method.
3. **Undo/Redo Logic**: Transactions that committed before crash but after the last checkpoint (or were active during checkpoint and committed later) are REDO. Transactions that were active and never committed are UNDO. Here, T1 and T2 committed (Redo), while T3 started but never committed (Undo).

Based on the job log provided, calculate all fundamental metrics and performance indicators. Given that the current date is 5/01/2024, assess whether the project is on schedule.
