(2) This is my mothers office where "she comes to work everyday".
(3) This is my mother's office where she comes to work everyday
(4) This is my mother's office, where she comes to work everyday

explanation.en: Option 4 is correctly punctuated: it starts with a capital letter, uses the possessive apostrophe correctly in 'mother's', and uses a comma before the relative clause which ends with a full stop.

text.en: Wooden and Iron boxes were placed on Sunita's table. Both the boxes fell down when touched. Sunita found that wooden box does not made any sound when dropped but a special sound is heard when Iron box is dropped. Which property of metals does it show?
text.pa: Wooden and Iron boxes were placed on Sunita's table. Both the boxes fell down when touched. Sunita found that wooden box does not made any sound when dropped but a special sound is heard when Iron box is dropped. Which property of metals does it show?

explanation.en: Sonority is the physical property of metals to produce a ringing sound when struck. Iron, being a metal, is sonorous and produces a sound when dropped, whereas wood is non-sonorous.

text.en: What will be the angle x in the following diagram? [IMAGE]

explanation.en:
According to the diagram, the angle between the incident ray and the plane mirror surface is \( 60^\circ \). The normal is perpendicular (\( 90^\circ \)) to the mirror surface.
The angle of incidence \( i \) is the angle between the incident ray and the normal:
\( i = 90^\circ - 60^\circ = 30^\circ \).
According to the Law of Reflection, the angle of reflection \( r \) is equal to the angle of incidence \( i \).
Since \( x \) is the angle of reflection (angle between the reflected ray and the normal), \( x = 30^\circ \).

text.en: Which of the following statement is correct regarding cone cells and rod cells present in the retina of human eye?
(1) Cone cells are sensitive to dim light and rod cells are sensitive to bright light.
(2) Cone cells and rod cells both are sensitive to bright light.
(3) Cone cells and rod cells both are sensitive to dim light.
(4) Cone cells are sensitive to bright light and rod cells are sensitive to dim light.

explanation.en: The human retina contains two types of photoreceptor cells: rods and cones. Rod cells are highly sensitive to low light levels (dim light) but do not detect color. Cone cells are sensitive to high light levels (bright light) and are responsible for color vision and visual acuity.

text.en: Write three main parts of the cell?

explanation.en: The three basic and fundamental parts of almost all cells (animal or plant) are the Plasma Membrane (outer boundary), the Cytoplasm (jelly-like internal fluid), and the Nucleus (control center containing genetic material). While other organelles exist, these three are considered the primary structural components.

text.en: In which part of the cell, organelles are present?

explanation.en: Cell organelles like mitochondria, ribosomes, endoplasmic reticulum, etc., are suspended within the cytoplasm, which is the fluid-filled region between the cell membrane and the nucleus.
In the female reproductive system, eggs (ova) are produced in the ovaries. The testes are part of the male reproductive system and produce sperm.

text.en: What is the jelly like substance between the nucleus and the cell membrane called?

explanation.en: The jelly-like substance that fills the space between the cell membrane and the nucleus is called the cytoplasm. It contains various cell organelles. Protoplasm refers to the entire living content of the cell, including the cytoplasm and the nucleus.

text.en: While praising new bicycle of Rambir, Rajdeep said that handle of the bicycle was too shiny. Rambir said that its handle does not even corrode. According to you, Handle of the bicycle is electroplated with which material?

explanation.en: Chromium is used for electroplating because it has a shiny appearance, does not corrode, and resists scratches. It is commonly used on bicycle handlebars and car parts.
A foetus is the stage of the embryo in which all the body parts can be identified. It is a more advanced or 'well developed' stage of development after the initial embryo stage.

text.en: The ratio of the length and breadth of rectangular plot is 11:4 the cost of fencing the plot at the rate of 100 rupees per metre is Rs. 75000 . Find the area of the plot.

explanation.en:
1. First, find the perimeter of the plot:
    Perimeter = \( \frac{\text{Total Cost}}{\text{Rate per metre}} = \frac{75000}{100} = 750 \text{ m} \).
2. Let the length \( L = 11x \) and breadth \( B = 4x \).
3. Perimeter of a rectangle = \( 2(L + B) \).
    \( 2(11x + 4x) = 750 \)
    \( 2(15x) = 750 \)
    \( 30x = 750 \Rightarrow x = \frac{750}{30} = 25 \).
4. Now calculate dimensions:
    Length \( L = 11 \times 25 = 275 \text{ m} \)
    Breadth \( B = 4 \times 25 = 100 \text{ m} \)
5. Area = \( L \times B = 275 \times 100 = 27500 \text{ m}^2 \).

1. Find the LCM of the denominators (4, 3, 3), which is 12.
2. Multiply every term in the equation by 12 to eliminate denominators:
    \( 12\left(\frac{3x - 2}{4}\right) - 12\left(\frac{2x + 3}{3}\right) = 12\left(\frac{2}{3}\right) - 12(x) \)
    \( 3(3x - 2) - 4(2x + 3) = 4(2) - 12x \)
3. Expand the terms:
    \( 9x - 6 - 8x - 12 = 8 - 12x \)
    \( x - 18 = 8 - 12x \)
4. Move all terms containing \( x \) to one side and constants to the other:
    \( x + 12x = 8 + 18 \)
    \( 13x = 26 \)
5. Solve for \( x \):
    \( x = \frac{26}{13} = 2 \).

text.en: If each edge of a cube is doubled, then how many times volume of cube be increased?

explanation.en:
1. Let the original edge of the cube be \( a \).
2. Original volume \( V_1 = a^3 \).
3. If the edge is doubled, the new edge is \( 2a \).
4. New volume \( V_2 = (2a)^3 = 8a^3 \).
5. Comparing the two: \( V_2 = 8 \times V_1 \).
Therefore, the volume is increased 8 times.

text.en: Find the measure of each interior angle of a regular polygon of 9 sides.
text.pa: Find the measure of each interior angle of a regular polygon of 9 sides.

explanation.en:
1. The formula for each exterior angle of a regular polygon with \( n \) sides is \( \frac{360^\circ}{n} \).
2. For \( n = 9 \), exterior angle = \( \frac{360^\circ}{9} = 40^\circ \).
3. Each interior angle is supplementary to the exterior angle: \( 180^\circ - 40^\circ = 140^\circ \).
Alternatively, use the formula for each interior angle: \( \frac{(n - 2) \times 180^\circ}{n} = \frac{(9 - 2) \times 180^\circ}{9} = \frac{7 \times 180^\circ}{9} = 7 \times 20^\circ = 140^\circ \).

text.en: A shopkeeper buys 10 eggs for Rs 8 and sells at 8 for Rs 10. Find his gain or loss percentage.
text.pa: A shopkeeper buys 10 eggs for Rs 8 and sells at 8 for Rs 10. Find his gain or loss percentage.

explanation.en:
1. Let's find the CP and SP for a common quantity (e.g., LCM of 10 and 8 = 40 eggs).
2. CP of 10 eggs = Rs 8
    CP of 40 eggs = \( 8 \times 4 = \text{Rs } 32 \).
3. SP of 8 eggs = Rs 10
    SP of 40 eggs = \( 10 \times 5 = \text{Rs } 50 \).
4. Since SP > CP, it is a profit.
    Profit = \( 50 - 32 = \text{Rs } 18 \).
5. Profit percentage = \( \frac{\text{Profit}}{\text{CP}} \times 100 \)
    Profit % = \( \frac{18}{32} \times 100 = \frac{9}{16} \times 100 = \frac{900}{16} = \frac{225}{4} = 56.25\% \).
6. \( 56.25\% \) is the same as \( 56\frac{1}{4}\% \) profit.

text.en:
Which of the following statements is true?
A. Resources are a great gift of nature.
B. Man himself is the biggest resource.
A) A and B are correct
B) A and B are incorrect
C) A is true and B is false
D) A is false and B is true.

explanation.en: Statement A is true because natural resources like water, minerals, and forests are provided by nature. Statement B is also true because human beings use their intelligence and skills to transform natural materials into useful products, making 'Human Resource' the most essential resource of all.

text.en: What type of soil is found in the area shown in the given map? [IMAGE]

explanation.en: The highlighted region on the map of India corresponds to the Deccan Trap area (primarily Maharashtra and parts of Gujarat and MP). This region is characterized by Black soil (also called Regur soil), which is formed from volcanic lava rocks and is famous for its ability to retain moisture, making it ideal for cotton cultivation.

text.en: Which system of administration was abolished in Bengal in 1772 AD, which established direct rule of the British East India Company in Bengal and this further enhanced the company's prominence?

explanation.en: The Dual System of Government (Dual Administration), where the Nawab held the responsibility (Nizamat) and the Company held the power (Diwani), was introduced by Robert Clive in 1765. It led to chaos and corruption. Warren Hastings abolished this system in 1772, bringing Bengal under the direct administrative control of the British East India Company.

text.en: Who established the jury system in Bengal in 1832 AD?

explanation.en: Lord William Bentinck introduced the jury system in Bengal through the Regulation VI of 1832, which allowed European judges the assistance of respectable Indians in civil and criminal cases.

text.en: Who said these words, "We do not want to maintain relations with the Britishers. We want our own government in India"?

explanation.en: This statement reflects the ideology of the 'Extremist' leaders of the Indian National Congress, particularly Bal Gangadhar Tilak, who was a staunch advocate for Swaraj (self-rule) and complete independence from British oversight.
The Ghadar Party was an international political movement founded by expatriate Indians (primarily Punjabis) to overthrow British rule in India. It was formed in 1913 in the United States and Canada.

The Naujwan Bharat Sabha was founded by Bhagat Singh in March 1926. However, it was a collaborative effort involving other prominent revolutionaries like Bhagwati Charan Vohra (who served as the propaganda secretary) and Rajguru. Therefore, 'All of the above' is the most appropriate choice in the context of its founding leadership.

text.en: Who adopted the "The Doctrine of Lapse"?

explanation.en: The Doctrine of Lapse was an annexation policy applied by the British East India Company in India until 1859. It was most extensively and famously used by Lord Dalhousie, who was the Governor-General of India between 1848 and 1856.

text.en: Which were the main demands of the Indian National Congress?
(1) To spread education in the country
(2) To separate the executive from legislature
(3) To reduce the expenditure being spent on military

explanation.en: In its early phase, the Indian National Congress had several administrative and economic demands, including the spread of western education, separation of the judiciary from the executive (and general administrative reforms), and reduction of the massive expenditure on the British Indian Army.

Analyze the pattern of each letter position separately:
1.  **First Letter**: P (16), N (14), L (12), J (10). The pattern is \(-2\). Next letter: \(10 - 2 = 8\), which is **H**.
2.  **Second Letter**: M (13), O (15), Q (17), S (19). The pattern is \(+2\). Next letter: \(19 + 2 = 21\), which is **U**.
3.  **Third Letter**: T (20), S (19), R (18), Q (17). The pattern is \(-1\). Next letter: \(17 - 1 = 16\), which is **P**.

Combining these, the next term in the series is **HUP**.

text.en: Choose the correct water image of figure (X) from given alternatives: [IMAGE]

explanation.en:
The water image is a vertical reflection.
1. Figure (X) is a star shape (hexagram) with a darkened triangle at the bottom-most point.
2. In the water image, the bottom point moves to the top position.
3. Therefore, the darkened triangle will appear at the top-most point of the reflected star.
4. Option (1) shows the darkened triangle at the top vertex, which is the correct reflection.

text.en: Choose the correct water image of figure (X) from given alternatives: [IMAGE]

explanation.en:
To find the water image of a figure, we reflect it vertically across a horizontal axis at its base. 
1. In figure (X), there are two dots in the upper portions of the outer crescent shapes. In the water image, these will appear in the lower portions.
2. In the bottom intersection of the two circles, there is a small curve (concave up). In the water image, this will move to the top intersection and flip to become concave down.
3. Option (1) correctly reflects these changes.

text.en: Hardeep saw that his brother Harjeet who is studying in fourth standard was observing carefully that mother was adding some curd in milk. Harjeet was surprised that how a small quantity of curd could convert whole of milk into curd. Hardeep explained him that some bacteria were responsible for this change. Can you suggest the name of such bacterias?

explanation.en: Lactobacillus is the genus of bacteria that promotes the formation of curd from milk by converting the lactose sugar in milk into lactic acid.

text.en: Which of the following non-metal is used as antibiotic?

explanation.en: Iodine is a non-metal that is widely used for medicinal purposes. Specifically, 'tincture of iodine' is used as an antiseptic/antibiotic on wounds to prevent infection.

text.en: Manpreet got infected from cold some days ago and his friend Arjun also got infected today. Their teacher told them that there are some diseases which get transmitted from infected person to healthy person and are called Communicable diseases. Which one of the following is not a communicable disease?

explanation.en: Communicable diseases (like cholera, cold, and TB) are caused by pathogens and spread from person to person. Goitre is a non-communicable disease caused by a nutritional deficiency (lack of iodine) and cannot be transmitted between people.

text.en: Kulwinder inserted open ends of two copper wire into the Potato and attach other ends to the battery. He noticed a green-blue spot at the point of insertion around one end of wire while there was no spot seen where second wire was inserted. Can you guess the terminal of the battery, to which the wire with green-blue spot is connected? [IMAGE]
4) Wire is not attached to any terminal

explanation.en: When electricity is passed through a potato using copper wires, a chemical reaction occurs. A greenish-blue spot is formed around the wire connected to the positive terminal of the battery. This is due to the chemical effect of electric current, where copper ions from the wire react with the compounds in the potato.

text.en: In 1920 AD, which movement was launched by Mahatma Gandhi in India?
text.pa: In 1920 AD, which movement was launched by Mahatma Gandhi in India?

explanation.en: The Non-Cooperation Movement was launched by Mahatma Gandhi on 4th September 1920, with the aim of self-governance and obtaining full independence as the Indian National Congress withdrew its support for British reforms following the Rowlatt Act and the Jallianwala Bagh massacre.

text.pa:
ਉਸ ਚਿੱਤਰ ਦੀ ਚੋਣ ਕਰੋ ਜੋ ਹਾਥੀ, ਭੇੜੀਏ ਅਤੇ ਜਾਨਵਰਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਸਹੀ ਸੰਬੰਧ ਨੂੰ ਦਰਸਾਉਂਦਾ ਹੋਵੇ:
Identify the diagram that best represents the relationship among Elephants, Wolves, Animals.
[IMAGE]

explanation.en:
1. Elephants and Wolves are two distinct species of animals.
2. Both Elephants and Wolves belong to the category of 'Animals'.
3. Therefore, in a Venn diagram, there should be two non-overlapping circles (representing Elephants and Wolves) inside a larger circle (representing Animals).
4. Looking at the options, diagram (3) matches this description.

text.en: Identify the figure from the 'Answer Figures' that would logically replace the question mark (?) in the 'Problem Figure' sequence to complete the series. [IMAGE]
text.pa: Identify the figure from the 'Answer Figures' that would logically replace the question mark (?) in the 'Problem Figure' sequence to complete the series. [IMAGE]

explanation.en:
To solve this non-verbal reasoning series, we track the movement of the dot relative to the vertices of the hexagon:
1. **Figure A to Figure B**: The dot moves from the top-right vertex to the diametrically opposite vertex (bottom-left). This is a movement of 3 vertices (or a $180^\circ$ rotation).
2. **Figure B to Figure C**: The dot moves from the bottom-left vertex to the top-left vertex. In a hexagon with flat top/bottom edges, this represents a movement of 2 vertices clockwise (skipping the middle-left point).
3. **Determining Figure D**: Following the pattern of moving to the opposite vertex (as seen in the first pair A-B), we apply the same rule to Figure C. The dot in Figure C is at the top-left vertex. Moving to its diametrically opposite vertex would place the dot at the **bottom-right** vertex.
4. **Matching with Options**: 
   - Figure (1) shows the dot on the top edge.
   - Figure (2) shows the dot at the top-right vertex.
   - **Figure (3)** shows the dot at the bottom-right vertex.
   - Figure (4) shows the dot on the bottom edge.
Therefore, Figure (3) is the correct completion of the series.

text.en: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ਵਿੱਚ ਮਨੁੱਖ ਦਾ ਸਭ ਤੋਂ ਵੱਡਾ ਖ਼ਜ਼ਾਨਾ ਕਿਹੜਾ ਹੈ?

explanation.en: ਪੈਰੇ ਦੀ ਸ਼ੁਰੂਆਤ ਵਿੱਚ ਬੋਲੀ ਨੂੰ ਇੱਕ ਖ਼ਜ਼ਾਨਾ ਦੱਸਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਇਸ ਨੂੰ ਕਾਮਯਾਬੀ ਦੀ ਕੁੰਜੀ ਮੰਨਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਲਈ ਬੋਲੀ ਮਨੁੱਖ ਦਾ ਸਭ ਤੋਂ ਵੱਡਾ ਖ਼ਜ਼ਾਨਾ ਹੈ।

text.en: ਬਚਪਨ ਵਿਚ ਮਨੁੱਖੀ ਮਨ ਉੱਤੇ ਕੀ ਚਿੱਤਰਿਆ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ?

explanation.en: ਪੈਰੇ ਅਨੁਸਾਰ, "ਬਚਪਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਮਨ ਉੱਤੇ ਚਿੱਤਰੇ ਲਫ਼ਜ਼ ਸਾਨੂੰ ਭੁੱਲਦੇ ਨਹੀਂ"। ਇਸ ਲਈ ਬਚਪਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਮਨ ਉੱਤੇ ਲਫ਼ਜ਼ ਚਿੱਤਰੇ ਜਾਂਦੇ ਹਨ।
ਚਰਵਾਹੇ ਉਹ ਲੋਕ ਹੁੰਦੇ ਹਨ ਜੋ ਪਸ਼ੂਆਂ (ਭੇਡਾਂ-ਬੱਕਰੀਆਂ ਜਾਂ ਹੋਰ ਡੰਗਰਾਂ) ਨੂੰ ਚਰਾਉਣ ਦਾ ਕੰਮ ਕਰਦੇ ਹਨ।

text.en: ਬੋਲੀ ਕਿਸ ਤੋਂ ਨਹੀਂ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਜਾ ਸਕਦੀ?

explanation.en: ਪੈਰੇ ਵਿੱਚ ਮਾਪਿਆਂ, ਵਿਉਪਾਰੀਆਂ ਅਤੇ ਗਵਾਲਿਆਂ ਤੋਂ ਸ਼ਬਦ (ਬੋਲੀ) ਸਿੱਖਣ ਦੀ ਗੱਲ ਕੀਤੀ ਗਈ ਹੈ। 'ਸਿੱਕਿਆਂ' ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਸਿਰਫ਼ ਇੱਕ ਉਦਾਹਰਨ/ਮੋਹਰਾਂ ਵਜੋਂ ਕੀਤੀ ਗਈ ਹੈ, ਇਨ੍ਹਾਂ ਤੋਂ ਬੋਲੀ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਨਹੀਂ ਜਾਂਦੀ।
ਪੈਰੇ ਵਿੱਚ ਕਿਹਾ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ ਕਿ "...ਲਫ਼ਜ਼ਾਂ ਦੀ ਛਣ-ਛਣ ਤੋਂ ਕੁਰਬਾਨ ਹੋਣੋਂ ਨਹੀਂ ਰਹਿ ਸਕਦਾ।" ਦਿੱਤੇ ਗਏ ਵਿਕਲਪਾਂ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ 'ਕੁਰਬਾਨੀ' ਸਹੀ ਭਾਵ ਨੂੰ ਦਰਸਾਉਂਦਾ ਹੈ।

text.en: 'ਬੋਲਣ ਵਾਲੇ ਨੇ ਕੀ ਕੁਝ ਆਪਣਾ ਬਣਾਇਆ ਹੈ' ਵਾਕ ਨਾਲ ਕਿਹੜਾ ਵਿਸ਼ਰਾਮ ਚਿੰਨ੍ਹ ਲੱਗੇਗਾ?

explanation.en: ਇਸ ਵਾਕ ਵਿੱਚ 'ਕੀ ਕੁਝ' ਵਰਤਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ ਜੋ ਕਿ ਇੱਕ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਪੁੱਛਣ ਦਾ ਸੰਕੇਤ ਹੈ, ਇਸ ਲਈ ਅੰਤ ਵਿੱਚ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨਵਾਚਕ ਚਿੰਨ੍ਹ (?) ਲੱਗੇਗਾ।

text.en: 'ਬਚਪਨ' ਸ਼ਬਦ ਕਿਸ ਕਿਸਮ ਦਾ ਨਾਂਵ ਹੈ?

explanation.en: 'ਬਚਪਨ' ਇੱਕ ਅਵਸਥਾ ਦਾ ਨਾਂ ਹੈ ਜਿਸ ਨੂੰ ਮਹਿਸੂਸ ਕੀਤਾ ਜਾ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਪਰ ਛੂਹਿਆ ਨਹੀਂ ਜਾ ਸਕਦਾ, ਇਸ ਲਈ ਇਹ ਭਾਵ ਵਾਚਕ ਨਾਂਵ ਹੈ।

text.en: 'ਛਣ-ਛਣ' ਸ਼ਬਦ ਵਿੱਚ ਕਿਹੜੇ ਵਿਸ਼ਰਾਮ ਚਿੰਨ੍ਹ ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਹੋਈ ਹੈ?

explanation.en: ਦੋ ਸ਼ਬਦਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਜੋੜਨ ਲਈ ਵਰਤੀ ਜਾਣ ਵਾਲੀ ਛੋਟੀ ਲਾਈਨ ਨੂੰ ਪੰਜਾਬੀ ਵਿਆਕਰਨ ਵਿੱਚ 'ਜੋੜਨੀ' ਕਿਹਾ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ।
ਪੈਰੇ ਦੀ ਆਖ਼ਰੀ ਲਾਈਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਸਪੱਸ਼ਟ ਲਿਖਿਆ ਹੈ: "ਅਸਲ ਵਿਚ ਬੋਲੀ ਮਨੁੱਖ ਦੀ ਆਤਮਾ ਦਾ ਚਿੱਤਰ ਹੈ।"

text.en: Who is considered as 'Milton of Bengal'?

explanation.en: According to the passage, Madhusudan Dutt is widely regarded as the 'Milton of Bengal'.
The term 'intelligentsia' refers to a social class of people engaged in complex mental and creative work and who provide cultural and political leadership, essentially intellectuals as a group.

text.en: Who was associated with the cultural and intellectual leaders of the time?

explanation.en: The passage states that Prafulla's father, Harish Chandra Ray, was closely associated with the cultural and intellectual leaders of the time.

text.en: How old was Prafulla when he visited the city for the first time?

explanation.en: The passage explicitly mentions that 'at the age of nine, little Prafulla set eyes for the first time, on the bustling city'.
Demeaning means causing a loss in dignity or respect. Among the options, 'insulting' is the closest in meaning.

text.en:
My father is___ SDO in the electricity board.
(Choose the correct determiner from the following)

explanation.en: The acronym 'SDO' is pronounced starting with a vowel sound (/ɛs.diː.oʊ/). Therefore, the correct indefinite article to use is 'an'.

text.en:
Narinder works hard _____ his brother is lazy.
(Choose the correct conjunction)

explanation.en: The sentence expresses a contrast between Narinder and his brother. 'Whereas' is a conjunction used to highlight such a contrast.
हिन्दी व्याकरण के अनुसार 'सम्राट' (पुल्लिंग) का सही स्त्रीलिंग रूप 'साम्राज्ञी' होता है।
इकारान्त स्त्रीलिंग शब्दों का बहुवचन बनाने के लिए अंतिम 'इ' को 'इयाँ' में बदल दिया जाता है। अतः 'मूर्ति' का बहुवचन 'मूर्तियाँ' होगा। विकल्प 2 में 'ती' दीर्घ है जो अशुद्ध है।

text.en: निम्न दिए गए शब्दों में से 'संज्ञा' शब्द चुनें।

explanation.en:
1) 'हमारा' एक सर्वनाम है।
2) 'पिंजरा' एक वस्तु का नाम है, अतः यह संज्ञा है।
3) 'धीरे-धीरे' एक क्रिया-विशेषण है।
4) 'स्वस्थ' एक विशेषण है।
'अचेत' का अर्थ होता है जिसमें चेतना न हो। 'मूर्च्छित', 'बेसुध' और 'बेहोश' तीनों ही इसके समानार्थी शब्द हैं। अतः सभी विकल्प सही हैं।

text.en: नीचे दिए गए शब्दों में से शुद्ध शब्द चुनें।

explanation.en: वर्तनी की दृष्टि से 'विषमता' (Inequality/Disparity) शब्द शुद्ध है, जिसमें 'ष' का प्रयोग होता है।

text.en: 'परिचय' शब्द का सही विशेषण विकल्प चुनें।

explanation.en: 'परिचय' (संज्ञा) से बना विशेषण शब्द 'परिचित' है, जिसका अर्थ है 'जाना-पहचाना' (Known)।

text.en: 'तड़ित' शब्द का सही पर्यायवाची विकल्प चुनें।

explanation.en: 'तड़ित' संस्कृत का शब्द है जिसका हिन्दी में पर्यायवाची 'बिजली' या 'दामिनी' होता है।

text.en: कवि माँ को किसका वरदान कह रहे हैं?

explanation.en: पद्यांश की पहली पंक्ति में स्पष्ट रूप से लिखा है - "ईश्वर का वरदान है माँ"।

text.en: माँ हमें कौन-सा पाठ पढ़ाती है?

explanation.en: पद्यांश की तीसरी पंक्ति के अनुसार - "जब जीवन का पाठ पढ़ाती माँ"।

text.en: पद्यांश में किसके गुणों का गान किया गया है?

explanation.en: सम्पूर्ण पद्यांश माँ की महिमा और उनके गुणों पर आधारित है।

instructions.en:
• (Please read the following instructions carefully before attempting questions) (कृपया प्रश्नों का उत्तर देने से पहले निम्नलिखित निर्देशों को ध्यान से पढ़ें)
  • 1. There are fifteen (15) questions in all. (कुल पंद्रह (15) प्रश्न हैं।)
  • 2. All questions are compulsory. (सभी प्रश्न अनिवार्य हैं।)
  • 3. No extra/additional sheet will be provided. (कोई अतिरिक्त / विशेष शीट प्रदान नहीं की जाएगी।)
  • 4. Answer must be written in the authorized medium. No marks will be given for answers written in a medium other than the authorized one. (उत्तर अधिकृत माध्यम में ही लिखना होगा। अधिकृत माध्यम के अलावा किसी अन्य माध्यम में लिखे गए उत्तरों के लिए कोई अंक नहीं दिए जाएंगे।)
  • 5. All questions carry equal marks i.e. 10 each. (सभी प्रश्न समान अंक वाले हैं, अर्थात प्रत्येक 10 अंक का है।)
  • 6. Each Question should be answered within the space provided for that particular question. Otherwise, the answer given will not be evaluated. (प्रत्येक प्रश्न का उत्तर उसके लिए निर्धारित स्थान पर ही लिखा जाए। अन्यथा, दिए गए उत्तर का मूल्यांकन नहीं किया जाएगा।)

instructions.en:
• This question paper is in two parts. / ਇਹ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਪੱਤਰ ਦੋ ਭਾਗਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਹੈ।
  • Part - I is related to Reasoning Test which consists of 30 questions. / ਪਹਿਲਾ ਭਾਗ ਤਰਕ ਯੋਗਤਾ ਨਾਲ ਸੰਬੰਧਤ ਹੈ, ਜਿਸ ਵਿੱਚ 30 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਹਨ।
  • Part - II relates to Scholastic Aptitude Test which consists of 120 questions relating to six subjects listed below:
    i) Mathematics : 30
    ii) Science : 30
    iii) Social Studies : 30
    iv) Punjabi : 10
    v) English : 10
    vi) Hindi : 10
    / ਦੂਜੇ ਭਾਗ ਵਿੱਚ ਵਿਸ਼ਿਆਂ ਦੀ ਯੋਗਤਾ ਨਾਲ ਸੰਬੰਧਤ ਨਿਮਨ ਦਰਸਾਏ ਛੇ ਵਿਸ਼ਿਆਂ ਦੇ 120 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਹਨ।
    1. ਗਣਿਤ : 30
    2. ਸਾਇੰਸ : 30
    3. ਸਮਾਜਿਕ ਵਿਗਿਆਨ : 30
    4. ਪੰਜਾਬੀ : 10
    5. ਅੰਗਰੇਜ਼ੀ : 10
    6. ਹਿੰਦੀ : 10
  • Each question carries one mark. All questions are compulsory. / ਹਰੇਕ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਦਾ ਇੱਕ ਅੰਕ ਹੈ । ਸਾਰੇ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਜਰੂਰੀ ਹਨ ।
  • You have been provided an answer sheet (OMR) for this question booklet. Darken the circle of correct option of each question in the answer sheet (OMR) with black/blue ball pen. / ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਇਸ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਪੁਸਤਿਕਾ ਲਈ ਇੱਕ ਉੱਤਰ ਸੀਟ (ਓ.ਐਮ.ਆਰ.) ਦਿੱਤੀ ਜਾਵੇਗੀ । ਉੱਤਰ ਸੀਟ (ਓ ਐਮ ਆਰ) ਵਿੱਚ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਦੇ ਸਹੀ ਉੱਤਰ ਦੇ ਗੋਲੇ ਨੂੰ ਕਾਲੇ/ਨੀਲੇ ਬਾਲ ਪੈਨ ਨਾਲ ਭਰ ਕੇ ਦਰਸਾਓ ।
  • Rough work may be done on the blank space provided for this purpose. / ਕੱਚਾ ਕੰਮ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਗਈ ਖਾਲੀ ਥਾਂ ਤੇ ਕੀਤਾ ਜਾ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ।
  • There is no negative marking in this test. / ਇਸ ਪ੍ਰੀਖਿਆ ਵਿੱਚ ਰਿਣਾਤਮਕ (ਨੈਗੇਟਿਵ) ਮਾਰਕਿੰਗ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੈ ।
  • Do not use white fluid on Answer Sheet (OMR). / ਉੱਤਰਸੀਟ (ਓ. ਐਮ. ਆਰ.) ਉੱਪਰ ਵਾਈਟ ਫਲਿਊਡ ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਨਾ ਕੀਤੀ ਜਾਵੇ।
  • Directions (Questions 14-15): In each of the following questions choose the correct water image of figure (X) from given alternatives:
  • Directions (Questions 19-20): Read the given sentences carefully and answer the question no. 19 & 20:

instructions.en:
This question paper is in two parts.

Part I is related to Reasoning Test which consists of 30 questions.

Part II relates to Scholastic Aptitude Test which consists of 120 questions relating to six subjects listed below:

  • (i) Mathematics - 30 questions
  • (ii) Science - 30 questions
  • (iii) Social Science - 30 questions
  • (iv) English - 10 questions
  • (v) Hindi - 10 questions
  • (vi) Punjabi - 10 questions

Each question carries 1 mark. There is no negative marking.

All questions are compulsory.

The candidates must fill in the correct option (i.e., 1 or 2 or 3 or 4) with blue/black ball point pen in the OMR Answer Sheet.

The candidates should not write anything on the question paper except his/her roll number.

The use of a calculator or any other electronic device is strictly prohibited.

Rough work can be done in the space provided at the end of the question paper.

Hand over the OMR Answer Sheet to the Invigilator before leaving the examination hall.

No candidate is allowed to leave the examination hall before the completion of the examination time.
instructions.pa:
ਇਹ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਪੱਤਰ ਦੋ ਭਾਗਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਹੈ।

ਪਹਿਲਾ ਭਾਗ ਤਰਕ ਯੋਗਤਾ ਨਾਲ ਸੰਬੰਧਤ ਹੈ, ਜਿਸ ਵਿੱਚ 30 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਹਨ।

ਦੂਜੇ ਭਾਗ ਵਿੱਚ ਵਿਸ਼ਿਆਂ ਦੀ ਯੋਗਤਾ ਨਾਲ ਸੰਬੰਧਤ ਨਿਮਨ ਦਰਸਾਏ ਛੇ ਵਿਸ਼ਿਆਂ ਦੇ 120 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਹਨ:

  • (i) ਗਣਿਤ - 30 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ
  • (ii) ਵਿਗਿਆਨ - 30 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ
  • (iii) ਸਮਾਜਿਕ ਵਿਗਿਆਨ - 30 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ
  • (iv) ਅੰਗਰੇਜ਼ੀ - 10 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ
  • (v) ਹਿੰਦੀ - 10 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ
  • (vi) ਪੰਜਾਬੀ - 10 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ

ਹਰੇਕ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਦਾ 1 ਅੰਕ ਹੈ। ਕੋਈ ਨਕਾਰਾਤਮਕ ਅੰਕ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੈ।

ਸਾਰੇ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਜ਼ਰੂਰੀ ਹਨ।

ਉਮੀਦਵਾਰ OMR ਉੱਤਰ ਪੱਤਰੀ ਵਿੱਚ ਸਹੀ ਵਿਕਲਪ (ਭਾਵ 1 ਜਾਂ 2 ਜਾਂ 3 ਜਾਂ 4) ਨੂੰ ਨੀਲੇ/ਕਾਲੇ ਬਾਲ ਪੁਆਇੰਟ ਪੈੱਨ ਨਾਲ ਭਰਨ।

ਉਮੀਦਵਾਰ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਪੱਤਰ 'ਤੇ ਆਪਣੇ ਰੋਲ ਨੰਬਰ ਤੋਂ ਇਲਾਵਾ ਕੁਝ ਵੀ ਨਾ ਲਿਖਣ।

ਕੈਲਕੁਲੇਟਰ ਜਾਂ ਕਿਸੇ ਹੋਰ ਇਲੈਕਟ੍ਰਾਨਿਕ ਯੰਤਰ ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਦੀ ਸਖ਼ਤ ਮਨਾਹੀ ਹੈ।

ਕੱਚਾ ਕੰਮ (Rough work) ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਪੱਤਰ ਦੇ ਅੰਤ ਵਿੱਚ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਗਈ ਖਾਲੀ ਥਾਂ 'ਤੇ ਕੀਤਾ ਜਾ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।

ਪ੍ਰੀਖਿਆ ਹਾਲ ਛੱਡਣ ਤੋਂ ਪਹਿਲਾਂ OMR ਉੱਤਰ ਪੱਤਰੀ ਨਿਗਰਾਨ ਨੂੰ ਸੌਂਪ ਦਿਓ।

ਪ੍ਰੀਖਿਆ ਦਾ ਸਮਾਂ ਖਤਮ ਹੋਣ ਤੋਂ ਪਹਿਲਾਂ ਕਿਸੇ ਵੀ ਉਮੀਦਵਾਰ ਨੂੰ ਪ੍ਰੀਖਿਆ ਹਾਲ ਛੱਡਣ ਦੀ ਇਜਾਜ਼ਤ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੈ।

instructions.en:
REASONING AND SCHOLASTIC APTITUDE TEST

SET - Ae

Time : 3 hours

Max. Marks : 150

Instructions for candidates:

  1. This question paper is in two parts.
  2. Part - I is related to Reasoning Test which consists of 30 questions.
  3. Part - II relates to Scholastic Aptitude Test which consists of 120 questions relating to six subjects listed below:
    • i) Mathematics : 30
    • ii) Science : 30
    • iii) Social Studies : 30
    • iv) Punjabi : 10
    • v) English : 10
    • vi) Hindi : 10
  4. Each question carries one mark. All questions are compulsory.
  5. You have been provided an answer sheet (OMR) for this question booklet. Darken the circle of correct option of each question in the answer sheet (OMR) with black/blue ball pen.
  6. Rough work may be done on the blank space provided for this purpose.
  7. There is no negative marking in this test.
  8. Do not use white fluid on Answer Sheet (OMR).
  • ਨਿਰਦੇਸ਼ : ਹੇਠਾਂ ਦਿੱਤਾ ਪੈਰਾ ਪੜ੍ਹ ਕੇ (ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਨੰ: 121-130) ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨਾਂ ਦੇ ਉੱਤਰ ਦਿਓ :
  • Direction : Read the passage given below and answer the questions (Q. No. 131-135)
instructions.pa:
ਉਮੀਦਵਾਰਾਂ ਲਈ ਹਦਾਇਤਾਂ:

  1. ਇਹ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਪੱਤਰ ਦੋ ਭਾਗਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਹੈ।
  2. ਪਹਿਲਾ ਭਾਗ ਤਰਕ ਯੋਗਤਾ ਨਾਲ ਸੰਬੰਧਤ ਹੈ, ਜਿਸ ਵਿੱਚ 30 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਹਨ।
  3. ਦੂਜੇ ਭਾਗ ਵਿੱਚ ਵਿੱਦਿਅਕ ਯੋਗਤਾ ਨਾਲ ਸੰਬੰਧਤ ਛੇ ਵਿਸ਼ਿਆਂ ਦੇ 120 ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਹਨ।
    1. ਗਣਿਤ : 30
    2. ਸਾਇੰਸ : 30
    3. ਸਮਾਜਿਕ ਵਿਗਿਆਨ : 30
    4. ਪੰਜਾਬੀ : 10
    5. ਅੰਗਰੇਜ਼ੀ : 10
    6. ਹਿੰਦੀ : 10
  4. ਹਰੇਕ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਦਾ ਇੱਕ ਅੰਕ ਹੈ। ਸਾਰੇ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਜਰੂਰੀ ਹਨ।
  5. ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਇਸ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਪੁਸਤਿਕਾ ਲਈ ਇੱਕ ਉੱਤਰ ਸੀਟ (ਓ. ਐਮ. ਆਰ.) ਦਿੱਤੀ ਜਾਵੇਗੀ। ਉੱਤਰ ਸੀਟ (ਓ. ਐਮ. ਆਰ) ਵਿੱਚ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ ਦੇ ਸਹੀ ਉੱਤਰ ਦੇ ਗੋਲ ਨੂੰ ਕਾਲੇ/ਨੀਲੇ ਬਾਲ ਪੈਨ ਨਾਲ ਭਰ ਕੇ ਦਰਸਾਓ।
  6. ਕੱਚਾ ਕੰਮ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਗਈ ਖਾਲੀ ਥਾਂ ਤੇ ਕੀਤਾ ਜਾ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।
  7. ਇਸ ਪ੍ਰੀਖਿਆ ਵਿੱਚ ਨਕਾਰਾਤਮਕ (ਨੈਗੇਟਿਵ) ਮਾਰਕਿੰਗ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੈ।
  8. ਉੱਤਰਸ਼ੀਟ (ਓ. ਐਮ. ਆਰ.) ਉੱਪਰ ਵ੍ਹਾਈਟ ਫਲਿਊਡ ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਨਾ ਕੀਤੀ ਜਾਵੇ।
